loans.name: Ngerechi

texts.en:
Ngerechi is a married woman. She has two children who are ages two and six years. She describes herself as aggressive.
She operates a retail store, where she provides a service of grinding maize into flour with her posho mill and sells the maize flour to customers. Her business is located at a busy area, and her primary customers are local residents. She has taken a loan of KES 62,900 to buy a gas cooker that will benefit her family. This will ensure that they can cook fast and save time. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. She hopes that in future she will be stable and successful.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Daniel Khon

texts.en: Daniel is a client of Finance Sudan Limited. He has borrowed four times before with us. He is a 33-year-old father of three children, and one of his children goes to school. He is a businessman who owns a bar that sells beer, water, sodas, and food to the clients. He also owns rental houses that give him some income. He is borrowing a loan of 3,500 Sudanese Pounds to buy more stock for his bar business. He intends to pay the loan from the profits he gets from the business and also to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy stock like sodas, beer, water, and food

loans.name: Maa Tarini Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Tarini Self Help Group has ten members who are all from the same neighbourhood. The president of this group is Bharati. Bharati is a 28-year-old married woman from the Khurda district of Odisha, India. The couple has two children who are in schooling. Bharati lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. 

For the past five years, Bharati has been involved in the activity of growing and selling vegetables; her husband and her parents help her in this activity. All other members of this group are engaged in other different kinds of activities like agriculture, cattle farming, etc. 

In order to strengthen the business and respond to customer demand, Bharati, together with her group Maa Tarini Self Help Group, has requested a loan amount of 140,000 INR for purchasing seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Their goal is to expand their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan tiene 31 años de edad, es acompañado y ha procreado un hijo. posee 15 años de experiencia en el trabajo de la agricultura, este aprendió con su papá desde que era un niño, para iniciar sus labores se levanta a las 5:00 de la mañana para llevar sus animales al potrero, luego de desayunar se va a su cultivo para iniciar con sus labores agrícolas, las cuales pueden durar medio día, para mantener su cultivo limpio de malezas y plagas, siempre siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y  7,000 metros cuadrados de yuca, ya que de estos cultivos es donde obtiene sus ingresos para la alimentación de su familia. 

Para comprar sus insumos tiene que abordar un autobús en su comunidad, en el cual viaja durante 25 minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad, ahí compra sus insumos, luego de realizar sus compras regresa a casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando para la compra de 10 sacos de fertilizantes y otros productos para beneficiar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y  7,000 metros cuadrados de yuca.

Al comprar todos sus insumos de un solo viaje, podrá evitar tanto viaje a la ciudad, lo cual le genera perdida de tiempo y compras mas caras. Al mismo tiempo dará un manejo oportuno a su cultivo, lo que le ayudara a obtener mayor cosecha y mayor ingresos para pagar su crédito y alimentar a su familia.

Juan planea ahorrar y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Juan, 31, is married and has one child.  He has 15 years of experience in the field of agriculture, which he learned from his father when he was a little boy.

He gets up at 5 in the morning to start work, taking his animals to the pasture.  After eating breakfast he goes to his field to start the farm tasks, which can take him half a day to keep his crop weeded and free of pests.  He always plants 7,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of yuca because with these crops he earns his income to feed his family.

He has to board a bus in his community to travel 25 minutes to the city where he buys his supplies.  After buying them he returns home.  

He's requesting the loan to buy 10 bags of fertilizer and other products for his 7,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of yuca.

By buying all his supplies in just one trip he'll be able to avoid going to the city so much, which results in wasted time and more expensive purchases.  At the same time he'll take care of his crop in a timely fashion, which will help him get a bigger harvest and better income to pay back his loan and feed his family. 

Juan plans to save money and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
Abdulaziz is a 29-year-old married man living in a poor area in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a man who exhibits good moral values and who is concerned with the well-being of his family. At this time, he is employed but is earning a low salary. He has had a small house. With the salary he earns he pays for the household expenses of his family. 

Abdulaziz is requesting a youth loan to buy construction materials, because he is making improvements to his house. He states that he feels happy and grateful to Kiva for the support that he is being provided, because this way he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, because he is making improvements to his house.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 33-year-old man from Nyamasheke District in the Western Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwandan Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Vincent started selling lights in November 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. 

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: William Manut

texts.en:
William is a client of Finance Sudan. He is a 30 year old married father of two children.  One of the children goes to school. 

He is a businessman, who engages in a retail business that sells mixed commodities that include, washing soaps, sodas, water and many other goods. He has employed one person, who helps him run the business. He is borrowing 1000 South Sudanese Pounds to help him expand his shop. 

He will use the profits from the sales to repay the loan. The loan will also help him improve his life and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy goods like washing soaps, sodas, water and other goods.

loans.name: John Piol

texts.en:
John is a Finance Sudan Limited client. He has borrowed four times before with the institution. 

He is a 32-year-old single man. He is a businessman who owns a retail shop that sells mixed items like cooking oil, sodas, water and many other commodities. He has been in the business for about six years now and has employed one person to help him run the business. 

John is borrowing a loan of 3,000 South Sudanese Pounds to help him expand his retail shop. He intends to buy more stock for his shop and in the future turn it into a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy mixed goods like cooking oil, sodas and many other items for his shop.

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en: Zakayo is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as committed. He has taken a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a solar panel that will benefit seven family members. He faces a challenge of high cost of fuel, hence the need for a cheaper source of energy. The family will be able to access lighting using the solar panel. He farms to earn an income. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel as a source of energy for lighting for his family.

loans.name: James Alfos

texts.en:
James is a client of Finance Sudan Limited, and has borrowed with us five times before. He is married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. 

He is a businessman, who sells fish in the market. He is borrowing 4000 South Sudanese Pounds to expand his business. He has seen an increase in his clients, and would like to use the loan to buy more fish so that he can satisfy their needs. His business is growing steadily. 

He will use the profits to repay the loan, and also to improve his family's life and pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more fish for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like sugar, bread, flour and tea for her hotel

loans.name: German Alger

texts.es: El Sr. Germán tiene 22 años, el se dedica al servicio de fotografía y filmado de distintos acontecimientos sociales, tiene su estudio fotográfico en la zona España de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, , este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Germán va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de una motocicleta ya que esa le ayudara a transportarse a los distintos acontecimientos sociales donde tiene que prestar sus servicio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere mejorara en su trabajo El Sr. Germán enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen muchas personas prestando su servicio de fotografos y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando equipos y materiales que necesita y su deseo es tener un estudio fotográfico con todos los equipos modernos para brindar a su clientela un servicio de calidad.
texts.en:
Germán, 22, makes a living photographing and filming various social events.  His studio is in the España area of the city of Santa Cruz.

This loan is Germán's second sequence with the institution.  He's going to use it to buy a motorcycle, which will help him travel to the various social events where he's offering his services.  He's requesting this loan because he wants to improve his job.

The challenge Germán faces in his work is competition, because a lot people offer photography services.

He's going to use his profits to continue buying the equipment and materials he needs.

He wants to have a photography studio with all the modern equipment he needs to offer his customers quality service.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam was born in 1966. She is married and has seven children. One of her daughters, 21 years old, is studying in the first year of the Diploma in Nursing. 

Hiyam is currently facing financial problems, as she doesn't have enough money to pay for her daughter's tuition fees. Therefore, she is now requesting a loan to pay for her daughter's fees for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La  señora  Ana  es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con   sus  3 hijos en la zona  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una pulpería.
Doña Ana el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de refrescos,  carnes,  maíz, leche, pollo, frijoles, manteca, jabón,  etc. con esta inversión espera tener más mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes,   su pulpería es muy conocida en la zona donde vive y tiene muchos clientes que le hacen bastantes pedidos.
Doña Ana con los ingresos que  obtenga espera mejorar  un poco su situación económica y la de su familia. En el futuro ella espera que su negocio sea  la  pulpería  más  grande del lugar. 
Doña Ana sueña con ver a sus hijos  convertirlos en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades  para la  sociedad




Choluteca, Honduras –  Julio  del  2013
texts.en:
Ana's a very responsible, honest, and hardworking person.  She lives with her three children in the southern part of Honduras.  Her business is a grocery store.

Ana needs the loan to buy refreshments, meat, corn, milk, chicken, beans, shortening, soap, etc.  With this investment she hopes to have more merchandise to offer her customers.  Her store is very well known in the area where she lives and she has a lot of customers who put in a lot of orders.

With the income she earns, Ana hopes to improve her economic situation and her family's.  She hopes her business will be the biggest store in the area in the future.

Ana dreams of seeing her children become honorable people with better opportunities for society.

Choluteca, Honduras, July 2013

loans.use: to buy provisions for her business

loans.name: Peter Akuoch

texts.en:
Peter is a client of Finance Sudan. He is a 28-year-old father of 3 children, 2 of whom go to school. He is a businessman who partakes in the business of selling mixed items like airtime, cooking oil, water, and many other commodities. He has been in business for about 4 years now and has employed one person to help run the business. 

He is borrowing a loan of 1000 Sudanese Pounds to help him buy more goods for resale. His main challenges are the fluctuating prices of goods and transport of the goods to the business premises. He will use the profits in the business to pay back the loan and also to help pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items like airtime, cooking oil, and water to sell.

loans.name: Ladu Alfos

texts.en:
Ladu, a client of Finance Sudan Limited for the past two years, has received five previous loans from us. A 40-year-old married father of seven children, four of whom are in school, Ladu is a businessman who primarily sells fish in the market, but also sells tomatoes, onions and some vegetables. He employs four more persons who help him in the running of the business.

Ladu is borrowing 4000 SSP to help him increase his stock in order to satisfy his demanding clientele. He will use the profits to repay the loan, pay school fees for his children and improve the lives of his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock including fish, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Saad

texts.en: Saad is 20 years old. He is currently studying for a Bachelor of Earth and Environment Sciences, and he is in his 2nd year. Saad lives with his family, which consists of 6 members, in Mafraq, Jordan. He is planning to expand his studies to get his masters degree in the future. He is currently facing financial problems, so he is requesting a loan to pay for his education fees.

loans.use: to pay for his education fees.

loans.name: Alfert Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a client of Finance Sudan Limited.  He has borrowed with us before. He is married with seven children, five of whom go to school. 

He is a metal fabricator, who has employed two more persons to help. He has been in the metal fabrication business for over 10 years now. He makes items like cooking pans, kettles, jugs, metallic bathing basins and many other metallic items. He is borrowing  2000 South Sudanese Pounds to buy more materials for his business. 

He will use the profits he gets from the business to pay back the loan. He will also be able to pay school fees for his children and feed his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for his metal fabrication business.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en: Haya is 21 years old. She lives with her family, which consists of 7 members, in Mafraq, Jordan. Haya is currently studying Bachelor of History, and she is in her 3rd year. She is planning to expand her studies to earn a Master's degree in the future. Now she is facing financial problems, so she is seeking a loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
Zaid is 21 years old. He lives in Irbid, Jordan with his family, which consists of 10 members. 

Zaid is currently studying for a bachelor's degree in math.  He is in his second year. He is planning to complete his studies in order to work in his field of study field after graduation, and help in covering his family's needs. 

As he is facing a financial crisis, he is requesting a loan to pay his study fees.

loans.use: to pay his study fees.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en: Husam is 21 years old. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan with his family, which consists of 11 members. Husam is studying for his Diploma of Graphic Design. He is in his first year and is planning to bridge his study to the university to get a Bachelor's degree. Husam is facing financial problems so he is seeking a loan to be able to pay for his study fees.

loans.use: To pay for his study fees

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud was born in in 1977. He is single and lives in Amman, Jordan in a rented house. Mahmoud opened his own cafeteria two months ago. He got the idea when he visited the area and found out that it needs a cafeteria, as it's full of activity and is missing such a project. Mahmoud faced some obstacles at the beginning of his project because of the financial problems that he faced. Now he is planning to expand his project to open more than one branch in the future in different areas. He is currently seeking a loan to buy mobile credit cards and some ingredients to start baking cookies, frying eggs and making pastries.

loans.use: To buy mobile credit cards and ingredients  to start baking cookies, frying eggs and making pastries

loans.name: Nael

texts.en: Nael is a 24-year-old man. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. Nael`s business is a grocery store, which he started 3 years ago with limited capital provided by his grandfather. It is the main source of income for feeding his family. Though he has been working hard, he can`t meet his customers' demands due to limited capital, as wholesalers require cash payment to provide him with grocery supplies. He has managed to attract more clients. He was happy about attracting new clients, but on the other hand, the financial challenge of meeting customers' demand is hindering his business progress and growth. Therefore, he took out a loan of 400,000 YER in order to purchase the grocery supplies that his shop needs. He hopes to expand his business more to be a successful entrepreneur in the area.

loans.use: to purchase the grocery supplies that his shop needs.

loans.name: Ammad

texts.en: Ammad is a 21-year-old single man. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has a grocery store where he sells various products. He was a worker in a retail shop. His objective is to improve his standard of living, so he managed to collect enough money to open his own grocery store. He would like to expand his business. Therefore, he is asking for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy more grocery products to offer to his clients. He hopes to increase his profit so he can open another grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en: Mr. Enhbayar is 27 years old and lives in the Uvs province of Mongolia with his wife and son in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent. He started his small business repairing auto wheels and tires in 2011. He has years of experience working in the auto repair service company. Recently, more wheels and tires auto repair shops opened and his income decreased. He is now planning to start an auto painting and auto body repair service business in his rental place. He already built close relationship with his customers and is well-known for his qualified services. His wife Erdenetsetseg has been taking care of their son Erhembayar and stays home, unemployed. He is planning to get his wife to attend a specialized training course to get a job in order to increase the family's income and start saving for his son's further education. He is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase equipment and tools for his new auto painting and body repair business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools for his auto painting and body repair business

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda was born in 1974. She is married and has six children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Huda has been working at trading clothes for eight years. One of the obstacles she faces is marketing her products. Huda is planning to start trading shoes with the clothes so she is seeking a loan to buy new clothes and shoes in order to trade them to raise her income.

loans.use: To buy new clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Natividad De Lourdes

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó tiempo atrás en este negocio por recomendación de familiares y hasta ahora le ha ido bien.  Trabaja con su primo, durante la mañana de 7 a 10 am.  Es separada de su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad (28, 24 y 21 años respectivamente).  Desea en un futuro poder crecer y fortalecer su economía y la de su familia.  Desea el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una laptop para el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The borrower is from the city of Libertad.  She started in this business sometime ago at the recommendation of family members, and so far it has gone well. She works with her cousin during the morning from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m.  She is separated from her partner and has three children, all adults, ages 28, 24 and 21.

She wishes to someday be able to improve and strengthen her financial situation and that of her family. She wishes the loan so that she can purchase a laptop to help her children with their studies.

loans.use: To buy a laptop.

loans.name: Oscar David

texts.es: El cliente reside en Libertad.  Aprendió el negocio desde pequeño junto a su papá y se convenció de que era una actividad muy productiva.  Trabaja todos los días desde temprano hasta la noche.  Es soltero y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Desea a futuro, poder terminar de construir su casa de bloques y mejorar ampliamente su negocio.  Por ahora desea el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima e insumos para su panadería.
texts.en:
The borrower lives in Libertad. He learned the business from a young age by working with his father, and became convinced that it was a very productive livelihood. He works every day from early until night time. He is single and has two children, who go to the local public school.

In the future, he wishes to be able to finish building his concrete block house and make extensive improvements to his business. For now he wishes the loan so that he can invest in the purchase of materials and ingredients for his bakery.

loans.use: To buy materials and ingredients for his bakery.

loans.name: Gerelt-Od

texts.en: Mrs. Gerelt-Od is 35 years old and a widow who lives with her two daughters and a son in a ger, traditional nomadic tent, in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She started a retail business with her husband years ago and after her husband passed away, she closed her business for a while. She is now planning to restart her retail business and purchase inventory from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, to sell to countryside customers. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who is requesting loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase large amount of inventory to sell to local customers.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of inventory to sell to local customers.

loans.name: Erhbayar

texts.en: Mr. Erhbayar is 24 years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Enhbayar has been working with his brothers and father in their furniture-making family business since 2008. They have gained a lot of experience and the quality of their products got much better and is comparable to Russian furniture imported to Mongolia. But their prices are low and affordable to local customers. He married his wife Baya in 2012 and her daughter Ariunjargal is 2 years old now. He is now starting his own business to support his family because his wife is currently unemployed and looking for job. He is now requesting 2,700,000 MNT to purchase wooden inventories to start his own furniture-making business.

loans.use: to purchase wooden inventories to start his own furniture making business.

loans.name: Bandr

texts.en:
Bandr is 18 years old. He is married and has a child with whom he lives in Sana`a, Yemen.

He works in agriculture. He hopes to increase his agricultural plots in order to increase his earnings and provide the best for his family.  He inherited the agriculture land from his father.

This is his first loan with Kiva and he feels grateful for the financial support that he is receiving in order to get ahead. He is committed to making his loan payments in a punctual manner. He will invest his youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy plowing to cultivate his land. He hopes that his agricultural business will continuously become more progressive so that he can earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy plowing to cultivate his land.

loans.name: Nyam-Osor

texts.en: Mrs. Nyam-Osor is 41 years old and lives with her three children in an apartment in the Tolgoit area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her older son is in military service and her younger two children attend local schools. She has been running a bag and eyeglass retail business at a rental counter in a local market for two years now and has acquired regular customers over the years. She has good taste in choosing bags and eyeglasses for her customers and is well known among her customers. Her business income is the only income source for the family and she is trying to raise her children to be highly educated and better people. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a variety of bags and eyeglasses to sell in her rental counter to increase her family income. She is a hardworking and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of bags and eyeglasses to sell

loans.name: Jamtsansambuu

texts.en:
Mr. Jantsansambuu is 31 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a Ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Soninhuu, is unemployed and stays home taking care of the family. His daughter, Purevsuren, is 7 years old and is a local primary school student; his son, Barsuren, is 5 years old and attends a local kindergarten. 

Jantsansambuu has been working in his wooden furniture and Ger manufacturing business since 2004 and has a lot of experience in the business. He has just gotten orders from a smaller administrative area within the province for 10 Gers and needs 2,000,000 MNT to purchase wood and other inventory to meet the order and increase his sales. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase wood and other inventory for his furniture and Ger manufacturing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like bar soaps, wheat flour, cooking oil, and many other items

loans.name: Laith

texts.en:
Laith is a 21-year-old single man from Jenin. He lives with his family in a small house. Laith works as an employee in the public sector and gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover his needs. Laith would like to buy a new car because it is a necessary thing these days, but he dont have enough money for it. 

Laith took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the remaining costs of the car he wants to buy. This car will help him to go to work easily and also do his private work. This will make his life easier. Laith's dream is to take another loan and open his own business. 

Laith appears in the photo beside his car.

loans.use: to pay the remaining costs of the car he wants to buy

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 29-year-old married man from Gaza City. He is the father for one young son. For the past nine years, Abdallah has been working as a kids' party coordinator. It is a profitable job and Abdallah is a well-known artist in his city. Abdallah would like to improve his business by purchasing more instruments. 

Abdallah requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help Abdallah to buy a new musical instrument (a keyboard). This will help him to improve his business and coordinate for more parties and events, especially for the summer season. 

Abdallah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new musical instrument (a keyboard) for his business

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives in a small house with his family. 

Abdallah studies at the university, and he is in his last year in the Education and Human Sciences Collage. Abdallah is a very smart young man, and he would like to complete his studies with good marks. 

Abdallah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a new laptop for his studies.  By applying this loan, Abdallah will be able to do his reports and homework very easily. 

Abdallah appears in the photo with his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Mohannad is a 40-year-old married man from Jenin. He is the father of two sons and two daughters. Mohannad works as auto repair mechanic in a workshop in the city. It is a good job, but he does not get a high income. Mohannad lives in a humble house with his family; his house needs some improvements but he does not have enough cash. 

Mohannad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to paint the house and buy a water tank. This will help him and his family to live in better conditions. 

Mohannad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to paint his house and buy a water tank

loans.name: Tawfeeq

texts.en: Tawfeeq was born in 1957. He is married and has six children. Tawfeeq has been working in his own rented bakery for one year with his son. His bakery is located in Wihdat, which is an area in Amman. One of the obstacles he faces is that he has many competitors in the same area. Tawfeeq is seeking a loan to buy a baking machine to make desserts and to change the decoration of his bakery in order to raise his income.

loans.use: to buy a baking machine to make desserts and to change the decoration of his bakery

loans.name: Ebrahim

texts.en:
Ebrahim is 25 years old, a resident of Sana`a, Yemen. He has been operating a grocery store for two years. He works hard to improve his living standards. He benefited from the first loan, where he expanded his business. 

He would like to increase his profit, so he applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy grocery products to expand his business. 

He is grateful to Kiva lenders for funding him on the first loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to expand his business.

loans.name: Orlom

texts.en: Mrs.Orlom is a 49-year-old widow who lives with her two daughters in a Ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her two daughters help in their mother's business and produces ice cream from organic milk at home. Orlom has been running her retail business at a rental counter in the local market for years and has already built close relationships with her suppliers and customers. She is now requesting loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory and to pay for her daughter's headache treatment in a hospital in Ulaanbaatar city. She and her daughters are hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and pay for her daughter's headache treatment in a hospital in Ulaanbaatar city

loans.name: Dugarsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Dugarsuren is a 47-year-old woman who lives with her two sons in a Ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her older son has just graduated university and is looking for a job and her younger son attends a local secondary school. Dugarsuren has worked as a saleswoman in a local market selling electric appliances for years and is now starting her own business of a general store at a rental counter of the local market. She is now requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for her general store business. She is a hardworking and welcoming person.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her general store business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein was born in 1989. He is single and lives with his two sisters as his parents passed away. Hussein is the youngest amongst his siblings. He has been working in his mini market for two months, which is a new project that will help him earn a good income. It will let him cover his sisters' needs. As we are in Ramadan, he is planning to buy more products and merchandise. Now he is seeking a youth loan to be able to buy this merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more products and merchandise for his mini market

loans.name: Susan James

texts.en: Susan is a client of Finance Sudan. She is a 22-year-old married mother of two young children. She is a businesswoman who has been doing it for about three years now. She is borrowing a loan worth 1,000 South Sudan Pounds to buy more stock for her shop. She sells items like sugar, salt, soft drinks, eggs, and many other mixed items. She intends to improve her business soon. She will use her profits to repay the loan and also pay the school fees for her siblings and medication for her young children.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, salt, soft drinks, beer, and eggs for her shop

loans.name: Mi Niño Jesus Iv Programa Group

texts.es: La Sra. Isabel  de 37 años de edad  soltera  y madre de  2 hijos, la Sra. Isabel  se dedica a la venta de menestras sancochadas en un pequeño local ya hace unos  1 años. La Sra. Isabel   ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más menestras   y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Isabel y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Isabel  es  la tercera   de la mano derecha  está sentada se le observa enseñando el cheque,se despide con un fuerte abrazo a Kiva y por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Isabel, age 37, is single, and she has two children.  Isabel has been selling boiled vegetable stews at a small place for one year.  Isabel has come to have loyal customers, which has generated income for her with which she has been able to cover the household expenses.

In the future she would like to have her own place and be able to sell her products to get greater income.  She will buy more vegetables with the loan that she has been granted.  

Isabel is the third from the right.  She is seated, and she can be seen showing the check.  She says good-bye with a strong hug for Kiva and the opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for stew.

loans.name: Diana Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora Diana se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el grupo de crédito Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad y se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan, su gente son personas amables, gentiles y trabajadoras que siempre están en la búsqueda de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

La Señora. Diana tiene 22 años y es madre soltera de un niño de 2 años de edad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive con su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, la casa en la que viven es arrendada.

Doña Diana se dedica a cuidarle a su hijo quien es aun pequeño, pero para solventar sus gastos y la de su familia se dedica al comercio,  vende una gran variedad de cosméticos los que ofrece de puerta a puerta a sus amigas y conocidas.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos  para continuar creciendo en este negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Diana is in her fourth credit as part of the Mujeres Floreciendo communal bank. She lives in the center of Cuenca, a city which was recognized as a World Cultural Heritage site in December 1999. Four rivers flow through it, it's gastronomic delights enchant visitors. The people are friendly, kind and hard-working, always searching for a better future for their families. 

Diana is 22 years old and single mother of a 2 year old child. As she has no house of her own, she lives with her mother and they share the household expenses. The house they live in is leased.

Diana is devoted to taking care of her son who is still young. In order to pay for their expenses she is in business. She sells a large variety of cosmetics, which she sells door to door to friends and acquaintances. The money from this loan will be used to buy cosmetics so she can continue to expand her business. Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: Marcial tiene 27 años , está casado con Edith y tiene una hija de 3 años con quien vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Marcial se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 6 años ya que logró adquirir su propio terreno en donde viene dedicándose a la producción de café y cacao orgánico. Al iniciarse una nueva campaña cacaotera ha notado que es necesario realizar una limpieza de maleza a sus plantaciones puesto que es uno de los factores que influyen en la obtención de granos de buena calidad. Marcial tiene como meta abrir una tienda de productos comestibles ya que así podra brindarle algo mejor a su hija. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y asi fortalecer sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Marcial, age 27, is married to Edith, and he has a three year old daughter.  They live together in a house made of wood.  Marcial has been a farmer for six years.  He managed to get his own piece of land where he produces coffee and organic cacao.  Upon starting a new cacao season, he has noticed that the weeds need to be cleared from his plants.  It is one of the factors that influences getting good quality grains.  

Marcial’s goal is to open a store with food products.  This way he will be able to provide something better for his daughter.

This is his first loan with Kiva.  He is grateful for the support his is receiving in order to get ahead.  He pledges to make his payments punctually.  He now wishes to have 1,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer.  This way he will strengthen his plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro,  se le presenta la necesidad d optar por un nuevo porque desea cultivar una manzana de maíz y le parece muy bien la forma de trabajar con la Institución; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, semilla, entre otros.
El crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que le permitió comprar una vaca y espera que en esta cosecha sea mucho mejor. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Pedro needs a new loan because he wishes to sow one ‘manzana’[7,000 square meters] of corn.  He really likes working this way with the institution.  This investment will help him to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and seeds, among others.

The previous loan was favorable because it allowed him to buy a cow.  He hopes that this harvest will be much better.  His financial condition and his family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and seeds, among others.

loans.name: Yajayra Nohely

texts.es: Yajayra es una joven de 23 años de edad  que está por culminar la carrera de enfermería, desde muy joven siempre le gustó  ayudar a personas delicadas de salud, es por ello que es buena en su carrera, tal lo demuestra sus notas.  Para cubrir con algunos gastos de la universidad tuvo que buscar trabajo, pues actualmente está al cuidado de un paciente. El préstamo lo destinará para una parte del pago de su titulación. Su mayor deseo es de culminar satisfactoriamente su carrera, pues ella sabe que de esta manera tendrá mejores oportunidades laborales. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Yajayra is a 23 year old young woman who is about to finish her nursing studies.  Ever since she was very young, she has always liked helping people in delicate health.  That is why she is good at her career, as her grades demonstrate.

In order to cover some of the university expenses, she had to look for work.  She is currently caring for a patient.

The loan is to pay for part of her final nursing educational expenses for her degree.  Her greatest wish is to satisfactorily complete her degree.  She knows that this way she will have better work opportunities.

loans.use: to pay for her degree.

loans.name: José Javier

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, esta acompañado y dos hijos.  Tiene aproximadamente 12 años de dedicarse al comercio informal de medicamentos. La necesidad de prosperar lo llevo a que se dedicara a este oficio, ya que por el mismo desempleo, no lograba conseguir una oportunidad, aparte que no tiene  titulo de bachiller, lo cual le dificultaba mas las cosas, para conseguir  trabajo. Antes de dedicarse a este trabajo se desempeñaba a trabajos de jornalero.

 Compra las medicinas en una farmacia, las cuales él vende de manera honesta, en los medios de transporte como lo son los buses.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar mas productos medicinales y poder comercializarlos.  Con la venta de los productos espera tener ingresos para mantener a su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida de ellos.
Espera conseguir  un lugar fijo donde instalar su propio negocio, y no tener que andar en los buses a diario ofreciendo los productos. También quisiera mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José, age 37, has a spouse and two children.  He has been involved in selling medications for approximately 12 years.  The need to prosper is what led him to this field.  Because of unemployment, he did not manage to find an opportunity.  Also, he does not have a high school diploma, which made things more difficult to find work.  Before this business activity he worked as a day worker.

He buys the medications at a pharmacy.  He sells them in an honest way on transportation vehicles like buses.

The loan will be used to buy more medicinal products to sell.  With the sale of the products, he hopes to have income to support his family and to improve their quality of life.

He hopes to get a fixed place to set up his own business so that he does not have to walk around on the buses every day selling his products.  He would also like to improve the infrastructure of his house.

loans.use: to buy medicinal products to sell.

loans.name: María Aurora

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del grupo de crédito Mujeres Floreciendo desde hace 15 años tiempo en el que ha establecido una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad y se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan, su gente son personas amables, gentiles y trabajadoras que siempre están en la búsqueda de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

La Señora. María tiene 68 años y es madre soltera de 2 hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad, están casados y viven independientes, la casa en la que vive es el fruto de su trabajo y sacrificio.

Doña María es vendedora ambulante de platos típicos, vende humitas, tamales, quimbolitos y una gran variedad de dulces, esto aprendió por habilidad  para sacar  adelante a sus hijos, también se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes y a la agricultura.

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres para la elaboración de sus platos típicos. 

Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Maria has been a member of the loan group ‘Flourishing Women’ for 15 years, in which time she has established very good friendships with all of her group members. She lives on the outskirts of Cuenca, which has been a World Cultural Heritage site since December 1999. The city is bathed in four rivers and its gastronomy captivates the palates of those who visit. The people are friendly, polite and hardworking and are always looking to create a better future for their families. 

Maria is 68 years old and is a single mother to two adult children who are married and live independently. The house where she lives is the fruit of her work and sacrifice.

Maria works as a street vendor selling traditional dishes such as humitas, tamales, quimbolitos and a great variety of sweets. She developed this skill in order to bring up her children and she has also worked in farming, raising chickens and guinea pigs. 

The money she receives from the loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies to make her traditional dishes. Her goal is to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Cruz Carmelina

texts.es:
La Señora. Cruz forma parte del grupo de crédito Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad y se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan, su gente son personas amables, gentiles y trabajadoras que siempre están en la búsqueda de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

Doña Cruz tiene 58 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos es casado y vive independiente, su otro hijo estudia y trabaja. Su esposo presta sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, la casa en la que viven es de propia.

La Señora Cruz se dedica al comercio, vende bocaditos que ella mismo realiza, dulces de toda clase de frutas y también se dedica a la venta de ropa, en este negocio se encuentra hace algunos años.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito por que el anterior le fue de mucha utilidad ya que lo invirtió en su negocio y obtuvo buenas ganancias. Su nuevo crédito lo va a  invertir en la compra de ropa y víveres para seguir en su negocio.  Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la unión y solidaridad, también porque los créditos le permiten continuar creciendo en sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Cruz is a member of the Mujeres Floreciendo communal bank. She lives outside the city of Cuenca, a city named as a World Cultural Heritage site in December 1999. Its gastronomic offerings entice visitors. Four rivers flow through it. Its citizens are friendly, kind and hard-working, always searching for a better future for their families.
Cruz is 58 years old is married and has two  grown children as fruit of this union. One is married and lives independently, the other studies and works. Her husband works as a security guard. They live in their own home.

Cruz sells snacks which she makes herself and pastries with all types of fruits. She also sells clothes, a business she started a few years ago.

She is requesting the same loan again as the last one was very helpful. She invested it in her business and saw good results. This new loan will be used to buy clothing and supplies to continue with her business. She enjoys her communal bank for the friendship and solidarity. Plus the loans allow her to continue to expand her economic activity.

loans.use: to buy clothing and supplies.

loans.name: Wilbert Alexander

texts.es:
Wilbert tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero. Tiene aproximadamente 10 años de estarse dedicando al trabajo de la agricultura. El trabajo lo aprendió de un tío quien lo creció, y cuando él tenia aproximadamente 13 años lo llevaba al campo donde tenían sembrado el maíz. Y así fue como empezó a gustarle y hoy en día desde entonces él siembra maíz, toda su vida se  a dedicado a ese oficio.

 compra la semilla, fertilizantes y herbicidas para controlar la maleza en  la ciudad; Viaja aproximadamente 7 kilómetros de los cuales, 3 le toca caminar para poder encontrar un bus que lo lleve a dicha ciudad.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar la semilla, fertilizantes y herbicidas, para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con la producción tendrá ingresos para cancelar el préstamo y seguir teniendo apoyo de la institución en un futuro y lo que le sobre poder guardarlo para construir una humilde casa. 

 Tiene pensado para el próximo año sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados mas de maíz, también quisiera construir una casa humilde para el momento en que decida acompañarse tener donde vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Wilbert is 28 years old and single.  He has been working in agriculture for approximately ten years.  He learned this work from an uncle who raised him .  When he was approximately 13, his uncle took him to the field where he had planted corn.  That is how he started to like it.  From then on he has grown corn, and he has devoted himself to this work all of his life.

He goes to the city to buy seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides to control the weeds. He travels approximately seven kilometers.  He needs to walk for three of them in order to be able to find a bus to take him to the city.

The loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn.  With the production he will have income to repay the loan and to continue having the support of the institution in the future.  He will be able to save what is left over to build a humble house.

Next year he is planning on planting 7,000 more square meters of corn.  He would also like to build a humble house so that when he decides to have a family, he will have somewhere to live with them.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima was born in 1950. She is married and has two sons; one is a blacksmith.  And they also has two daughters; one is married. 

Her husband is retired.  Fatima started working in her mini market four years ago.  Her market sells very specified products. 

Fatima is planning to buy new products and a new freezer in the future. Now she is seeking a loan to buy more foodstuffs.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives and works outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county.  Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. 

Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas.  Maize is the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest and the variety of crops grown in the area also make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Peter is married, and has fifteen children.  He has been farming for forty years, and is currently growing sugar cane, sweet potatoes, cassava, maize and beans on his land.  He enjoys beekeeping because it is a good source of income that does not require too much labor. 

This will be Peter’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his loan to educate his children and buy more hives.  Peter’s dream for the future is to save up enough money to buy cows and to start a fishery project.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives and works close to Kakamega town, in Kakamega county.  Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border.  It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping.  It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rate.

Francis is married, and has eleven children.  He has been farming for thirty five years, and is currently growing maize, sugar cane and bananas on his land.  Francis is excited to start beekeeping because it is not hard work and the bees take care of themselves. Interestingly, Francis is the brother of Honey Care Kiva borrowers Vincent, Peter and Joseph from Kakamega.

This will be Francis’ first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to buy food for his family and educate his children. Francis’ dream for the future is, “for my children to have good jobs after schooling and for my family to live a happy life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila lives and works close to Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country.  Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugar cane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Petronila is married, and her husband works as a chief with the local government. She runs a small clothing business, and also grows maize, bananas and trees, and she raises poultry and pigs.  Petronila likes beekeeping because it does not involve hard work, and produces returns. 

This is Petronila’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to expand her clothes-selling business.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives and works close to Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya.  It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Agnes is married, and has three children. Her husband is a retired city council officer, and now he and Agnes work on their land.  They have been farming for twenty years, and are currently engaged in dairy farming.  They also rear poultry and grow maize.  Agnes is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper because it produces reasonable income, and honey is medicinal. 

This is Agnes’ first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to start a small business selling vegetables.  Her hope for the future is to see her small business succeed.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: La Churonita  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito La Churonita está formado por 10 mujeres quienes son amigas y vecinas, viven por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que es conocida por la su belleza arquitectónica, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía es muy cautivadora al igual que el calor de su gente. Las socias laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que le dan la oportunidad de mejorar su estabilidad económica y   salir adelante con sus familias, son mujeres que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Blanca, se encuentra realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito La Churonita. Tiene 37 años, es divorciada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 16 años que está estudiando en el colegio. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un hermano.

Doña Blanca hace poco inicio su propio negocio, puso una tienda de abarrotes en la cual trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. 

Su crédito lo va a  invertir en la compra de víveres para implementar mas su local. 

Su sueño es viajar a Paris.
texts.en:
The loan group ‘La Churonita’ is made up of ten women who are neighbours and friends. They live on the outskirts of Cuenca, a city which is known for its beautiful architecture. The city is bathed in four rivers and its gastronomy is as captivating as the warmth of its people. The group members work in different areas, which give them the opportunity to improve their economic stability and bring up their children. The women still maintain the culture and traditions of their parents.

Blanca is one of the group members. She is taking out her first loan alongside her friends as a member of ‘La Churonita’. She is 37 years old and divorced, however she bore a son from her marriage who is now 16 and is studying at school. She does not have her own home so she lives in her brother’s house.

Blanca began her business only a short while ago, setting up a grocery store where she works from Monday to Saturday to no fixed hours. 

Her loan will be invested in purchasing supplies to stock up her store. Her dream is to travel to Paris.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives and works close to Kakamega town, in Kakamega county.  Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest.  Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop.  The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Catherine is married, and has four children. Her husband works as a community health worker.  Catherine has been farming for five years, and is currently tending to poultry and dairy cows on their land.  Catherine is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper because honey is medicinal, and she is excited to have access to honey for her family to eat. 

This is Catherine’s first loan, and she plans to expand her beekeeping farming and get more hives.  Her hope for the future is “to become a successful business woman.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
Aggrey lives and works close to Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border.  It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping.  It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rate.

Aggrey is married, and has two children. His wife works as a teacher, while he engage in projects on their land.  Aggrey has been farming for four years, and is currently growing millet, cassava, bananas and trees on their land.  Aggrey was interested in beekeeping because he had good forage on his farm, so he wanted to see how beekeeping would do there. 

This is Aggrey’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to help him start a business.  Aggrey’s hope for the future is, “to buy a big farm and build a nice house.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos. Desde muy joven se a dedicado a trabajar, ayudaba a su madre a los queseares del hogar y también a trabajar en la agricultura en compañía de su padre; ya que eran una familia de escasos recursos económicos no tenían la condición para el pago de mosos trabajaba toda la familia, a sus 22 años se acompaño y en esa unión procrearon dos hijos, trabajaba en compañía de su compañero de vida al pasar los años la abandono y tuvo que tomar el cargo de padre y madre para sus hijos, siempre trabajando en casa y ademas con sus hijos trabajando la agricultura con mucho esfuerzo a logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Compra los insumos agrícolas en un municipio a 8 kilómetros de su casa; luego tiene que pagar un medio de transporte para que se lo lleven a su casa 

El préstamo sera utilizado para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, compra de fertilizantes abonos y para la preparación de la tierra. Al final de la cosecha tendrá mayor producción porque utilizara buenos insumos agrícolas y tendrá mayor ingresos

su plan para el futuro es, construir una pequeña vivienda para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old, and she has two children.  She has worked ever since she was very young.  She helped her mother with the household chores, and she also worked in the fields with her father.  She did this because the family had scarce financial resources, and they were not able to pay workers.  The whole family worked.

When she was 22 she entered into a relationship, and they had two children.  She worked with her life partner, but as the years passed, he abandoned her.  She had to take on the responsibility of being father and mother to her children.  She was always working at home.  Also, her children were working in agriculture.  With great effort, she has managed to get her children ahead.

She buys the agricultural supplies in a municipality that is eight kilometers from her house.  Then she has to pay for transportation to take them to her house.

The loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies for growing 7,000 square meters of corn.  She will buy fertilizers to prepare the land.  At the end of the harvest she will have greater production because she will use good agricultural supplies, and she will have greater income.

Her plan for the future is to build a small house for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for growing 7,000 square meters of corn and to buy fertilizers to prepare the land.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 32 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa de madera el cual fue construido con el fruto de su trabajo. María se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en el primer piso de su vivienda. Comenta que tuvo mucha suerte al momento de establecer su negocio ya que no había suficientes negocios de este tipo en su comunidad y se lo permitió ganarse a la clientela. Le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que le permite tener ingresos para su familia y estar mucho tiempo con sus hijos. Desea seguir trabajando con el entusiasmo que la caracteriza para convertirse en una comerciante mayorista dentro de su zona. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 500 nuevos soles para comprar productos comestibles tales como arroz, leche, harina, entre otros.
texts.en:
María, age 32, is the single mother of three children.  She lives with them in a house made of wood, which was built with the fruit of her labor.  María sells food products on the first floor of her house.  She says that she had a lot of luck when she established her business because there were not enough businesses of this type in her community.  This allowed her to win over her clientele.

Her work really pleases her because it allows her to have income for her family and to spend a lot of time with her children.  She wishes to continue working with the enthusiasm that she is known for in order to become a wholesale merchant in her area.

This is her first loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the financial help she is getting in order to get ahead.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She now wishes to have 500 soles to buy food products like rice, milk, and flour, among others.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, milk, and flour, among others.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives and works close to Kakamega town, in Kakamega county.  Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya.  It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Charles is married and has nine children.  His wife works as a housewife, while Charles farms their land.. They are currently growing millet and maize. Charles is an experienced beekeeper, and he is looking forward to expanding the number of his hives as he has found the income from honey to be helpful. 

This is Charles’ first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to help pay his children’s college fees.  Charles’ hope for the future is, "to save up enough to build a good house for my family.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben lives and works close to Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest.  Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop.  The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Ruben is married, and has eight children. His wife tends to their house, while Ruben farms; he is currently growing maize and sugar cane.  Ruben is excited for the opportunity to get beehives because he has always wanted to be a beekeeper.

This is Ruben’s first loan, and he plans to use the income to help his family, especially with his sons, who are in need of assistance.  Ruben’s hopes for the future are to, “be a successful farmer and business man.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives and works close to Kakamega town, in Kakamega county.  Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border.  It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping.  It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rate.

Agnes is married and has three children.  Her husband is a retired teacher, and Agnes farms their land.  She has been farming for fifteen years and is currently growing bananas and tending to a tree plantation.  Agnes likes beekeeping because bees make honey, and she loves honey because it is tasty and medicinal. 

This is Agnes’ first loan, and she plans to use the income to take care of her children, as well as the son of her brother, who is now an orphan after his father passed away.  When asked about her dreams for the future, Agnes said she hopes to, “have a stable family and for my children to have good jobs.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, su esposa y no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz, el oficio lo aprendió de familia y lo desempeña de 6:00am a 2:00pm; dificultad que posee es el cambio de clima y la ventaja es que cultiva en lo propio.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a adquirir lo necesario y  así obtener una cosecha abundante.
Su sueño es construir su vivienda para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
José lives with his family and his wife.  He does not have relatives abroad.  He is a farmer, and he grows corn.  He learned this trade from his family.  He works from 6:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m.  The difficulty that he has is the change in climate.  The advantage that he has is that he works on his own.

The loan that he is requesting will allow him to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides, among others.  This investment will help him to get what he needs.  This way he will get an abundant harvest.

His dream is to build his house in order to provide his loved ones with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides, among others

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
María es una mujer emprendedora de 22 años de edad, madre soltera de una niña de 5 años de edad.  Se dedica  a los trabajos  del hogar  con mucho  empeño y a demás  a las labores del campo  acompañada de su padre quien desde los 10 años siempre le ha apoyado en las diversas tareas agrícolas.

Los materiales para la producción agrícola los compra en un lugar ubicado  a 40 minutos de la comunidad y  40 minutos más transportándolos  a pie hasta la vivienda.  

El Crédito  será utilizado para la compra de insumos agrícolas: 3 litro de abono foliar, 2 quintales de formula 1 galón de insecticidas y el resto  del dinero  para el pago  de mano de obra de las personas que colaboran  con las actividades agrícolas.

Con el préstamo se solventara la necesidad de cubrir la compra de los insumos agrícolas para la siembra de frijol  dando mayor oportunidad para que la cosecha sea abundante  y se obtengan mayores ganancias  a la hora de comercializar la producción. 

La calidad de Vida familiar se vera notablemente beneficiada pues al tener la disponibilidad de  efectivo  para los insumos agrícolas se podrán obtener ganancias  en la comercialización que les permitirá   tener la solvencia económica para invertir en otros rubros como especies menores (Cerdos  y Aves)  y así crecer de manera honesta  la economía familiar.

En el Futuro, piensa continuar sus estudios de computación que tiene inconclusos con el fin de tener acceso  a un empleo  y poder brindarle  a su  hija la educación adecuada sin ningún problema  y ayudar a su padre con la siembra de granos básicos  de manera económica.
texts.en:
María, 22, is an enterprising woman.  She's the single mother of a daughter, 5.  She devotes herself with a lot of effort to the household labor.  She also does farm labor with her father, whom she has helped with various agricultural activities since she was 10 years old.

She buys her agricultural supplies in a place 40 minutes away from her community; it takes another 40 minutes to carry them home on foot.

She'll use the loan to buy agricultural inputs: 3 liters of foliar compost, 2 quintals of formula fertilizer, and 1 gallon of insecticide.  She'll use the rest of the money to pay for the labor of the people who help with the farming work.

The loan will cover the purchase of supplies for the bean crop, providing the opportunity for an abundant harvest and greater profits when it comes time to sell the crop.  This will noticeably benefit her family's quality of life because with the availability of cash they'll be able to earn profits from the sales.  This will give them the economic solvency to invest in other areas such as small animals (pigs and poultry) and increase the family finances honestly.

In the future she plans to finish her studies in computer science so she can get a job and be able to give her daughter the appropriate education without any problems and help her father financially with growing basic grains.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to pay for labor

loans.name: Iris Yoselyn

texts.es: Iris es una joven  de 18 años de edad, que hace 6 meses comenzó a  estudiar la carrera de técnica de enfermería. Pues siempre le interesó la idea de poder ayudar a otras personas.  Actualmente su madre es quien le apoya con los gastos del instituto.  Al culminar su carrera técnica, piensa convalidar con una universidad   la carrera de enfermería licenciada. Con el crédito que obtuvo comprará una computadora, pues esto le facilitará realizar sus trabajos. Iris agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito.
texts.en:
Iris is an 18 year old young person.  Six months ago she began studying to to get a technical degree in nursing.  She was always interested in the idea of being able to help other people.  Her mother currently helps her with the institution’s expenses.

When she completes her technical studies, she plans to strengthen it with a university degree as a licensed nurse.

She will buy a computer with the loan that she got.  This will facilitate her doing her work.  Iris is grateful to the people who made this loan possible.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: La Buena Amistad Group

texts.es:
Elsa pertenece a la alcancía La Buena Amistad
Elsa vive con su padre y su hijo. Ella es soltera y trabaja como comerciante, su negocio está ubicado en un mercado de su zona allí vende productos de abarrotes toda clase de menestras, fideos y productos enlatados. Su trabajo le permite solventar la manutención de su hijo y ayudar a su padre. Elsa se siente orgullosa por tener su propio negocio y siempre se esmera por ofrecer productos de calidad para que sus clientes siempre le compren, el préstamo que ha solicitado lo utilizara para invertir en su negocio con la compra de productos de abarrotes, de esa manera su negocio seguirá creciendo, mas adelante le gustaría tener otro puesto para aumentar sus ingresos.
Elsa agradece a los inversores el apoyo que le brindan al darle este préstamo tanto a ella como a su grupo comunal, en la foto es la segunda de la izquierda(parada) viste chompa negra,la foto de la derecha pertenece a la Sra.Rosa Maria.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to La Buena Amistad Communal Bank.  She's single and lives with her father and her son.

Elsa works as a merchant.  Her business is located in a market in her area.  She sells grocery products: all types of legumes, pasta, and canned goods.  Her job allows her to support her son and help her father.  Elsa's proud to have her own business and she goes to a lot of effort to offer quality products so her customers will always buy from her.

The loan she has requested is to invest in her business by buying groceries so her business will continue to grow.  Later she would like to have another place to increase her income.

Elsa's grateful to the investors for their support through this loan to both her and her communal bank.  In the photo she's the second from the left (standing); she's wearing a black sweater.  The photo on the right is of Rosa María.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Juan Elias

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su familia, su padre y su madre. El, posee una ciber y asimismo una peluquería para generar ingresos, el oficio lo aprendió de familia y no tiene ninguna dificultad porque lo practica.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar la materia prima para la peluquería, tal como: silla para cortar el cabello; esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar sus ingresos y así tener una mayor estabilidad de vida.
Su sueño es adquirir más computadoras y tener un ciber con el equipo necesario para  satisfacer las optativas de los clientes.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his family, his father and his mother.  He has a cyber cafe and a barbershop in order to generate income.  He learned this trade from his family.  He does not have any difficulty because he practices the trade.

The loan that he is requesting will allow him to buy materials like a chair for cutting hair for his barbershop.  This investment will help him improve his income and have greater stability in his life.

His dream is to get more computers and to have a cyber cafe with all of the equipment needed to satisfy his customers’ requests.

loans.use: to buy a chair for cutting hair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies, cash wholesale, for making hot dogs, hamburgers, salchipapas (fried hot dogs and potatoes), lunches and also to purchase beer and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a conservative woman, so she let her husband take her place in the picture. She was born in 1979. She is married and lives in Madaba, Jordan. She has four children. 

Abeer's husband has been working in livestock trading for two years, which is a weak source of income that might not cover their children's needs. He started his project with trading a small number of goats. Abeer is now seeking a loan to buy more livestock to trade in order to increase their income and be able to cover all their children needs.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to trade.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida lives and works close to Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Leonida is married and has five children. Her husband is a retired officer, while Leonida engages in projects on their land. She has been farming for twenty years, and is currently growing maize and sugar cane as well as tending to cows. When asked why she wanted to become a beekeeper, Leonida replied “I love that bees make honey because it is medicinal.”

This is Leonida’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to start a small business, probably a shop. Leonida says her hope for the future is "to own a shop to help me depend on myself not my children.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb lives and works close to Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Caleb is married and has six children. He and his wife have been farming for twenty-five years. They are currently growing rice, millet, maize and cassava on their land. Caleb is excited to start beekeeping because "it’s economic and bees do all the work while I get cash.”

This is Caleb’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to invest in a clothing sales business. His hope for the future is “to stabilize my financial situation and build rental houses.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Richard is married and has six children. His wife is a retired teacher, while Richard engages in projects on their land. He has been farming for 35 years, and is currently growing maize, bananas, and fruit trees. Richard likes beekeeping because it requires minimal labor, allowing him to focus on his other farming. 

This is Richard’s first loan and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to invest in his other farm activities since his hope for the future is to open up other projects on his farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Joseph is married and he has four children. His wife works as a banker, while Joseph is involved with education and engages in projects on their land.
