loans.use: to buy clothes for her husband to sell at a profit.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak is 50 years old. She lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom, located to the northeast of Phnom Penh. She is a widow who works hard to bring up her two children until they are married. She relies completely on income from agriculture, such as growing rice and raising some animals and poultry in her yard. Despite adversities, she aims to continue to grow her farming business and to improve it to a commercial farming level.  At the moment, she would like to have loan support, so she will be able to renovate her house. She will use this loan to buy strong house columns to replace in those in her house and to buy planks of wood and timbers needed for construction. Her future dreams involve buying a bigger piece of land and planting more rice to ensure a high production and income.

loans.use: to buy strong house columns to replace the ones in her house and to buy planks of wood and timbers needed for construction.

loans.name: Ruth Mery

texts.es: Ruth tiene 26 años, es una persona trabajadora que se dedica a su familia y a su actividad, tiene 2 hijos bajo su cargo, uno de ellos asiste al colegio y el otro todavía es pequeño para poder ingresar al colegio, Ruth se dedica a la cría de cerdos ya hace 4 años, ella empezó con 4 hembras productoras y ahora cuenta con 51 cerdos los cuales son 25 hembras 2 verracos y 24 lechones, los mismos que ella los vende en el mercado de su comunidad, Ruth esta solicitado este crédito para poder realizar la construcción de corrales en su granja ya que su ganado creció mucho y ya no tiene espacio para poder criar a los lechones que están naciendo y con los corrales estarán mejor los lechones, Ruth mejorara  sus ingresos de esta manera además podrá darles una mejor calidad de vida, Ruth agradece por el  préstamo que le están dando ya que gracias a eso podrá darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ruth, 26, is a hard-working person who is dedicated to her family and her work. She is responsible for two children, one who is attending school and the other who is still to young to enter school. Ruth has worked raising pigs for four years. She started with four breed sows and now she has 51 pigs - 25 sows, 2 males, and 24 piglets. She sells them at the market in her community. She is asking for this loan to be able to build pens on her farm, since her herd has grown a lot and she doesn't have the space to be able to raise the piglets that are being born and the piglets will be better off with the pens. Ruth will increase her income this way and it will give them a better quality of life. Ruth is grateful for the loan that is being given to her because she will be able to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to build pens on her farm.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory, 50, has four grown children. She remains responsible for the daily needs of her family. She is very hardworking and kind to her community.
 
To make her business more productive and competitive, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the loan to purchase canned goods, food snacks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste to sell in her store. 

In the future, Glory hopes that her business will further expand so that she can save enough money for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, food snacks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lope

texts.en:
Lope is known in their community as a very nice person. She is 48 years old and comes from the village of San Juan. She did not expect to have an auto repair shop, but because she has worked hard to attain her dream of having her own business, she managed to put up this type of business. 

To complete the needs of her auto-repair shop she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy a machine for her business. Lope envisions that someday, she can see her shop expand so that she can improve the quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy a machine for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a loyal partner from Cavite, Philippines. Her variety store is going strong as she is using the money in her business. Her income from her business is helping her in sending her children to school and in sustaining her family's everyday needs. She and her husband are continuously working to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merlita dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena farms in Kangundo town. She keeps livestock and grows cash crops to sell. These include maize and beans. She is 47 and married with 4 children. 

This is her first loan term, and she plans to use the money to buy fertilizer and feed for her cattle. She anticipates making more income from the produce which she will use to start horticulture farming. 

She hopes to improve her farming and become successful in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cow feed.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
This is Aurelia. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and materials needed in her farming business. The profits from this business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Aurelia dreams of having a greater variety of plants and hopes to have a peaceful and happy life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that they study.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and materials for her farming business.

loans.name: Cristobal Antonio

texts.es:
Cristobal tiene 73 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene siete hijos vive con la compañera en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Cristobal se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es comprar un carro para el trabajo, en los tiempos libres ver television
texts.en:
Cristobal is 73 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has seven children.  He lives with his partner in the Terrenal area of the Pueblo Viejo canton in the province of Los Rios.  He is a member of the Terrenal community bank, which is located in the Terrenal area of the Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of the group work as farmers and fishermen.  

Cristobal works as a farmer planting corn and rice.  He will use this loan to purchase supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and insecticides to avoid pest infestations and diseases.  He will make the purchases is the city of Pueblo Viejo.  

His dream is to purchase a car for his work.  In his free time, he likes to watch television.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers, manure, and insecticides to avoid pest infestations and diseases.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is a Kenyan woman with five children who attend school. They all live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
 
She has operated a vegetable stall business for the past three years. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and stiff competition.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to add to her stock by buying items including fruits, sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to add to her stock by buying items including fruits, sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Sara Nohemy

texts.es: Sara, tiene 30 años de edad, esta soltera, vive con sus padres en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de artículos electrodomésticos y estudiaba, pero hace  2 años logro establecer un negocio de venta de comidas como ser pollo frito con tajadas, tacos, enchiladas, carne asada etc. Además vende refrescos, jugos y otras golosinas. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos de donde cubre sus gastos, el cual lo tiene establecido en un local donde paga alquiler. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 15,000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de mesas, sillas y cortinas para el negocio. El objetivo de Sara es tener su negocio muy bien amueblado para la comodidad del cliente.
texts.en:
Sara is 30 years old, is single, and lives with her parents in the municipality of Quimistan, Santa Barbara. 

She used to sell household appliances while studying, but 2 years ago she managed to establish a business selling food such as fried chicken with fried plantains, tacos, enchiladas, roast beef, etc. She also sells soft drinks, juices and other candies. This business, which is established in a rented location, is her source of income. 

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Honduran lempiras to purchase tables, chairs and curtains for the business. Sara's aim is to have her business very well furnished for her customers' convenience.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs and curtains to improve her business.

loans.name: Mercedes Elena

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 39 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Camana con su esposo, actualmente ellos se encuentran muy felices ya que Mercedes esta esperando a su primer bebé, Mercedes es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, ella no ha podido estudiar la carrera de Agronomía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Caldo de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Mercedes trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agricola de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de lavado, corte, pelado de hortalizas y otros, Mercedes trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas. 
 Mercedes se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, ya que actualmente ella y su familia utilizan una cocina a kerosene la cual presenta desperfectos y su uso es peligroso, de esta manera Mercedes y su familia podrán preparar adecuadamente sus alimentos, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 39-year-old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Camana with her spouse. They are currently very happy because Mercedes is expecting her first baby. Mercedes is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the necessity that she work, she wasn't able to study the degree in Agriculture that she wanted to take. In her free time, she likes to distract herself by watching TV, and at times she cooks a delicious chicken soup to share with her family.

On her own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Mercedes works as a field labourer at an agricultural estate in her city. She works washing, cutting and peeling vegetables, among other tasks. Mercedes works every day starting early in the morning, and she can work for about eight hours.

Mercedes is very appreciative of Kiva lenders, since she will be able to buy a stove thanks to the help being offered. She and her family currently use a kerosene stove that is damaged, and using it is dangerous. With a new stove, Mercedes and her family will be able to prepare their food adequately, and she will continue to work and push herself to achieve her great dream of having her own home.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 22 years old and does a motorcycle transport business in Kangundo town. He is single and supports his parents. He has been in this business for three years and currently makes a monthly income of 30,000 Kenya shillings.

This is his second loan term with KADET Ltd., and he plans to buy another motorcycle for the transport business. He will use the generated income to provide for the needs of his family members as well as repay the loan.

He hopes to grow his business and own more motorcycles for the transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jo-Ann

texts.en:
Jo-ann lives in Inasagan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is a single entrepreneur who has been running a general store in their community for two years to earn a living. He has helped his parents with this kind of business.

In 2010, he joined Gata Daku MPC to improve his ability to engage in business and the general living conditions of his family as well. Jo-ann borrowed a loan from Gata Daku's micro credit, in addition to his working inventory capital, to buy rice and feeds for sale.  He plans to expand his business and save a portion of his generated revenue for his future.

loans.use: to buy rice and feeds for sale

loans.name: Paulinah

texts.en:
Paulinah is 44 years old and married with two children. She sells polythene bags which she also supplies to market traders for packaging their produce. She also sells charcoal in Kangundo town. She has been in this business for the past two years.

This is her second loan and she plans to buy more stock of polythene bags and charcoal to sell. She will use the generated income to provide for the needs of her family.

She hopes to grow her business and become successful hence be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To add more stock of polythene bags and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
This is Eugenia. She previously accessed a loan of 33,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which she used to buy different products for her buy-and-sell business, such as sponges, combs, cotton buds, insect sprays and mirrors. Her earnings were a big help to the education of her children and the family’s personal, household and business expenditures.

Eugenia would like to apply for another loan, this one for 50,000 PHP, to buy sponges, combs, cotton buds, insect sprays, mirrors and other products for her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay her children’s educational expenses.
 
She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different products, such as sponges, combs, cotton buds, insect sprays and mirrors, for her buy-and-sell business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used buy more fruit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She has a variety store for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruit needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elena hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having their own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and find strength from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruit for her business.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 22 años de edad de estado civil Soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz . Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos y semillas.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es comprar mas terreno para seguir trabajando, en los tiempos libres le gusta salir con los amigos a jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Jorge is 22 years old, single and he doesn't have children. He lives with his parents in "Recinto Terrenal", which belongs to the "The Old Town of the River" Province. 

He belongs to the "Ventanilla Terrenal" which is located in "Recinto Terrenal". People in the "Pueblo Viejo" Province work mainly in farming and fishing. 

Jorge is a farmer and grows corn. With this loan he will buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure and seeds. He will make his purchase in the city of Pueblo Viejo. 

His dream is to buy more land to work. In his free time he likes to go out with his friends and play soccer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost and seeds

loans.name: Sandra Fabiola

texts.es:
Sandra  tiene 23 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con los padres y el hijo de 2 año de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Sandra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz hace dos años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para la meleza. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder trabajar las tierras y comprar lo necesario.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente es la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es tener terreno propio.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ayudar a la mamá.
texts.en:
Sandra is 23 years old, single, and has one child. She lives with her parents and her two-year-old child in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.

Sandra is a member of the San Juan communal bank, which is located in the neighborhood of San Francisco and part of the parish of San Juan. The members are farmers.

Sandra works growing rice and corn since more than two years back. She buys and sells in Ventanas. She is applying for this loan in order to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, urea, and herbicides. The loan will be of great help because she can work the land and buy what she needs. Among the challenges she faces on a frequent basis are the competition and pests. Her dream is to have her own land.

In her free time, Sandra enjoys helping her mother.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and urea

loans.name: Shahzadi

texts.en:
Shahzadi is a 34-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of a son and planning to grow her family. 

Her husband works on a lathe machine and produces the digging parts of tractors. He has been doing this business since 2004 and until this time, his business has been much settled. Due to continuously working, the tools of the lathe machine have gradually depreciated, and they need to be replaced with new tools. Her husband has already been spending his savings upon the maintenance of the lathe machine and does not have a sufficient amount to buy new tools.

Shahzadi requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy new tools for working on the lathe machine. Shahzadi hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To replace the worn out tools on the lathe machine.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a farmer in Kangundo town where she plants maize, beans and vegetables for selling. She is 48 years of age, married, and has four children. Her husband also provides additional income for the support of the family.

This is Grace's third loan term with KADET Ltd., and she plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs. These include fertilizers and seeds for planting in her farm. She will use the generated income to buy more farm inputs for use in her farm.

Grace hopes to improve her farming and become one of the best farmers in the area, hence making more income and being able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, 24, is in a common-law relationship and has one child. She is a resident of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She started working in the agricultural sector, including growing rice, cassava, and raising hogs. Her husband works to manage their rice and cassava plants while she takes the main responsibility for feeding the hogs and poultry at home. 

Heng is asking for a loan amounting to KHR 2,500,000 to help her buy five pigs to fatten for meat to sell for a profit. She plans to utilize a portion of the loan to invest in growing cassava on two hectares of farmland. She hopes to have a good profit after selling her pigs and crops when they are mature. She dreams of having a suitable house to live in with her family, and educating her child until he becomes a professional and strong enough to stand alone.

loans.use: to buy five pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel de 25 años de edad, es soltera y sin hijos, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres. Maribel se dedica a la agricultura desde muy niña, pero de manera independiente hace 6 años. Considera que es una de las mejores actividades que puede realizar ya que tiene mucha experiencia cosechando cacao orgánico.
Al iniciarse una nueva campaña productiva, espera sacarle el máximo provecho posible a sus terrenos contratando mano de obra por parte de los trabajadores del lugar quienes se encargan de sembrar las plantas de almácigo y el deshierbo de maleza. Por otro lado suele comprar sacos de abono orgánico para fertilizar el suelo de sus tierras y obtener muy buenos productos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y así fertilizar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Maribel, age 25, is single and does not have children.  She currently lives in her parents’ house.  Maribel has been farming since she was a little girl, but she has been working independently for six years.  She feels that it is one of the best business activities that she can do because she has a lot of experience harvesting organic cacao.

Upon starting a new productive season, she hopes to take the maximum advantage that is possible of her fields by hiring day workers in the area to plant the seedling nursery plants and the to clear the weeds.  She generally buys sacks of organic fertilizer to fertilize the land where she plants and to get good products.

This is her first loan with Kiva.  She is grateful to receive a financial support that allows her to get ahead.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  

She is now requesting 3,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer to fertilize her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Carlos Julio

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal República Del Ecuador se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive el señor Carlos, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 9 y 3 años, el mayor  estudia en escuela. La esposa es ama de casa.
 
Don Carlos para salir adelante junto a su familia se dedica al comercio desde hace dos años, él tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, aguas, sodas, entre otras cosas. Su negocio es muy pequeño pero le deja ganancias para que a su familia no le falte nada.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal 2 ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos mejora su tienda. 

Su meta es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Republic of Ecuador Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that are highly visited throughout the year and for being a beautiful city without equal, with many tourist attractions. 

Carlos lives in this city. He is 29 years old and he lives in a common law marriage from which he has two children who are 9 and 3 years old. The older child studies in school. His spouse is a housewife. 

In order to get ahead, together with his family, Carlos has worked in business for two years. He has a grocery store in his home. Here he sells all kinds of products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, water, and sodas, among other items. His business is very small but it provides him with earnings so that his family is not lacking anything. 

He will use this loan to better supply his store. He is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other basic necessities. He has been in the Communal Bank for two cycles and he likes it because the loans improve his store. His goal is to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, sausages and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old, married, and has four children. She does farming in Kangundo town. She plants cash crops such as maize and beans and also keeps dairy cattle. She has been in this business for two years and it has been profitable. Besides agriculture, she also has a retail shop business.

This being her first loan term with KADET LTD, she plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm as well as cow feed for her dairy cattle. She will also buy more stock of goods to sell in her retail shop and these include rice, sugar and cooking oil.

She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children. In future, Mary hopes to grow her farming business and become successful and thereby be able to provide good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and goods to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old and has a grocery business in Kangundo town. She is married and has two children. She has been in this business for two years and the income has enabled her to provide for the needs of her family.

This being her second loan from KADET LTD, she plans to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell. She also plans to buy potatoes, tomatoes and onions. She will use the generated income to add more varieties of grocery items to sell.

She hopes to grow her business and open a grocery shop at the market and supply groceries to her customers.

loans.use: To add to her stock of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with six children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Margaret has operated a firewood selling business for the past four years. She sells from home to her neighbours.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to open up a wholesale business for selling firewood. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to open up a wholesale business for selling firewood

loans.name: Junrey

texts.en:
Junrey is married with an only child. He lives in Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur with his family. He owns and operates a farm growing and harvesting corn for sale. He has been doing this for more than three years to earn a living. 

He joined Gata Daku MPC in 2012 and recently he borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He also used a portion of this loan to finance the costs of weeding maintenance for his farm. He planned to cultivate the adjacent farm to generate additional harvest. 

He is hopeful to gain more income for the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is 34 years old and single. She sells clothes in Makueni town. These include shirts, trousers, and blouses. She has been in this business for three years and it has been profitable. 

This is her first loan term and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of trousers, shirts, and t-shirts to sell in her business. She will use the generated income to buy more varieties of clothes to sell as well as improve her living standards.

She hopes to grow her business by opening a boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married mother of two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Josphine has operated a kiosk business for the past three years, selling to passersby and neighbors. In addition, she does farming as her other source of income. She cited seasonality and transport as challenges in the business. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cooking oil, packets of pens, bundles of wheat flour, beans and peas. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, packets of pens, bundles of wheat flour, beans and peas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fixed assets (a canopy, display cases, chairs, tables) and supplies (pastry, pies, fruit cup, oatmeal, cake, soda)

loans.name: Jani

texts.en:
Jani is a father of six school-aged children. Their family lives in a beautiful village in rural southeastern Albania where Jani has been practicing animal husbandry for the past ten years. 

“The fact that our village is not very far from the main city, makes it easy for almost every villager to take their fresh produce to the city market. Some of us have established our clientele and we deliver our products to the client’s location and some others have built their little stands in the city streets to sell the produce. 

We usually leave our homes as early as 5 am to go to the city and return after noon to continue working on our fields or take care of the animals and/or produce dairy products ourselves. It is very exhaustive, though, for anyone who does it,” was what Jani said to the interviewer. 

Jani will use this loan to buy feed for his animals.

loans.use: To buy feed for his animals

loans.name: Ana Rosalia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 35 años de edad, esta divorciada y con dos hijos.  Es una persona muy conocida en la zona donde vive, ella se a dedicado desde los 20 años a estudiar cosmetologia hasta que se graduó de la academia; luego comenzó a trabajar en una sala de belleza en la cual comenzó de ayudante, empezando  a adquirir experiencia en los cortes, peinados y a ha hacera los nuevos estilos de peinados en la cual eso la hizo que sobresaliera y se destacara con los clientes.
Luego con el pasar de los años decidió optar por tener su propio negocio,  solicito un crédito para concretizar ese proyecto. Luego se caso y tubo dos niños en la cual hoy en día ella se encuentra divorciada y desde entonces, ella los a crecido, su hijo tiene 12 años y la niña tiene 6 años los dos estudian, con el negocio de la sala de belleza los a podido crecer a los dos ella sola, es una madre muy responsable.       
 
La señora compra los productos a una vendedora de productos de cosmetologia como por ejemplo:              shampoo, rinces, tinte para cabello, tratamiento para el cabello. Que en realidad son varias empresas con las   cuales ella compra el producto, pero cuando no tiene los compra en la sala de belleza de una amiga.  

La señora utilizara el crédito para compra mas productos que le hacen falta para el negocio; ya que se a quedado con poco dinero por el motivo que se le enfermo la niña y tubo que gastar  y ver que no tenia suficiente producto decidió optar por el crédito para comprarlos  y tener surtido de producto para  la venta.

La necesidad que sera satisfecha es el de poder comprar el producto para tener un ingreso y al momento que el cliente solicite un producto ella podrá venderlo al cliente. Mejorara su calidad  de vida en el ingreso diario en el negocio y así poder dar el estudio, la ropa para vestir a su hijos. 

Su propósito es, seguir trabajando con la Fundación Campo a medida que valla transcurriendo el tiempo, para terminar el crédito y poder solicitar otro nuevo según la necesidad.
texts.en:
Ana, age 35, is divorced and has two children.  She is very well-known in the area where she lives.  When she was 20 she began studying cosmetology until she graduated from the academy.  Then she started to work in a beauty salon, where she started as a helper.  She started by getting experience in cuts, styling, and doing the new hairstyles.  This made her excel and stand out with the customers.

Then, as the years passed, she decided to have her own business.  She requested a loan to firm up this project.  She later got married and had two children.  She is now divorced, and the children have grown.  Her son is 12, and her daughter is 6.  They both go to school.  She has been able to raise them on her own with the beauty salon business.  She is a very responsible mother.

She will buy the products from a woman who sells cosmetology products like shampoo, rinses, hair dyes, and hair treatments.  Actually, she buys products from various companies.  However, when she runs out she buys them at a friend’s beauty salon.

She will use the loan to buy more products that she needs for her business.  This is because her daughter got sick, which cost her.  She was left with little money.  She did not have enough products, so she decided to request a loan to buy them and to have her products stocked for sale.

The need that will be satisfied is being able to buy products in order to have more income.  Also, when a customer requests a product, she will be able to sell it to the customer.  She will improve her quality of life with the daily income from her business.  This way she will be able to give her children an education and clothing.

Her plan is to continue working with the Fundación Campo as time passes in order to complete this loan and to be able to request another one according to her needs.

loans.use: to buy more products that she needs for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, salt, and soap, among others.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita tiene 29 años de edad, esta casada con Julián con quien tiene dos hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Julián se dedica a la agricultura en unos terrenos que le cedierón sus padres al casarse . Tiene como producto principal el cacao orgánico ya que es un producto muy rentable en su zona y así puede obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
Lo alentador es que a pesar de iniciarse con poco capital ha logrado cubrir con todos los gastos familiares básicos considerando que ya poseen la responsabilidad de sus pequeños hijos, no obstante el trabajar en conjunto ha sido una gran herramienta de unión pues la comprensión y la armonía familiar priman en su hogar.
Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante con sus estudios. En está ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevo soles para pagar por adelantado el alquiler de un terreno agrícola para asi incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Sarita, age 29, is married to Julián, and they have two children, ages 12 and 8.  They live together in their own house.  Julián farms the land that his parents gave him when they got married.  His main product is organic cacao because it is a very profitable product in their area.  This way they get better income.

It is encouraging that in spite of starting with a little capital, he has managed to cover all of the family’s basic expenses as they are now responsible for their two little children.  Nevertheless, working together has been a great tool for their union.  Understanding and familial harmony rule in their household.

This is her second loan with Kiva.  She is grateful to receive a financial support that allows her to get ahead with their education.  She now wishes to request 3,000 soles to pay in advance to rent agricultural land to start increasing their production.

loans.use: to rent farmland.

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: yadira del carmen de 41 años de edad soltera con 6 hijos que aun estan bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega conocida como la tierra del Ron y del Azúcar.Esto se debe a que este municipio se encuentran establecidas dos de las más grandes empresas en Nicaragua: una azucarera,  y la otra licorera, yadira posee un puesto de comida (Comedor) en su casa de habitacion labor que realiza a diario, ofreciendo mas de un plato de comida, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de Chinandega, y sus ventas son al contado a clientes fijos y al credito a clientes eventuales, por lo general sus ventas al credito son a personal de un hospitalito cercano. el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de granos basicos, verduras, variedades de carnes pollo, frutas entre otros para realizar la comida. Yadira esta muy contenta con la ayuda que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos economicos.
texts.en:
Yadira Del Carmen, age 41, is single and has six children who are her responsibility.  She is from one of the municipalities in Chanandega that is known as the land of Rum and Sugar.  This is because two of the largest companies in Nicaragua, a sugar company and a liquor company, are established in this municipality.

Yadira has an eatery in her house.  She works there every day, and she offers more than one dish.  She makes her purchases for cash at the markets in Chinandega.  She sells for cash to fixed customers and on credit to casual customers.  Generally her credit sales are to personnel at a nearby hospital.

The objective of this loan is to buy basic grains, vegetables, a variety of meats, chicken, and fruits, among others, in order to make the food.  Yadira is very happy about the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people with few financial resources.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables, a variety of meats, chicken, and fruits, among others.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 49 years old and does dairy farming in Kangundo town. She is married and has five children. Besides farming, she also runs a retail shop business. Her husband also provides income in support of the family.

This being her second loan term, she plans to buy more stock of dairy feeds for her dairy cattle. She also plans to use part of the loan amount to buy more stock of goods to sell in her retail shop. These include sugar, milk, soap, rice, and flour. She will use the anticipated income to buy another dairy cow.

In future Susan hopes to grow her farming business, make more income, and be able to provide good education for her children, as well as install electricity in her home.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes does farming in Kangundo town where she plants maize, beans, and vegetables to sell. She is 55 years old and married with 8 children. She has been in this business for 20 years and currently makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

This will be her second loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of fertilizer and seeds for planting. She hopes to generate more income that she will use to buy more farm inputs.

She hopes to grow her farming business by planting more cash crops to make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian does agriculture in Kangundo town where she plants cash crops such as maize and beans for selling. She is 38 years old and a widow with five children. She has been in this business for 10 years and it has been profitable.

This is Lilian's first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the amount to buy fertilizer, manure and seedlings for planting in her farm. She hopes to generate more income which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

Lilian hopes to do dairy farming and have many dairy cattle as well as be able able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, manure and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Godella

texts.en:
Godella is from the village of Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 45 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Godella owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Godella has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 3,750 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Godella joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business.  Godella is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a fishing net. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a 45-year-old married woman who lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has four children. Over the past years, Chona has operated a family member's business, selling fish while her husband does the fishing. Her monthly earnings of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) help provide for her family’s daily needs. Aside from this, she is engaged in a lampakanay business, weaving lampakanay leaves. Unlike abacca, they use lampakanay leaves to weave deco products, baskets, etc.  

Chona is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase bundles of split lampakanay leaves to be used in the business. Chona joined GDMPC in 2011. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of split lampakanay leaves.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion's previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to support her family through the income from her business. Her business is continuously expanding as she used her loan in buying the needed items in her variety store. Her husband who is a driver is helping her to support their family.

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Salvacion prays for strength and guidance from God to herself and her whole family. She hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta's previous loan was a big help not just in her business but also in her household expenditures. She has been in this business for eight years now. She and her husband are working together to sustain their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for a new 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to loan to buy additional hogs and feeds needed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Violeta dreams to have more customers that will patronize her product and hopes for good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional hogs and feeds needed for her business.

loans.name: Olga Cecilia

texts.es: Olga, a sus 46 años de edad es casada y madre de 3 hijos. Se dedicaba a ser ama de casa, pero hace 4 años aproximadamente comenzó a vender productos por catálogo para obtener ingresos extra y aportar a la economía de su hogar. Ella ofrece perfumes, cosméticos, lencería, accesorios, entre otros y, sus principales clientes son familiares y amigos, con esto ha podido generar ingresos para contribuir con el sostenimiento de su hogar. Olga es una mujer con empuje, emprendedora y dedicada a su familia, que es el principal motor de su vida, por ello siempre va en busca de oportunidades que le permitan prosperar, es así como se motiva para solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, lencería, accesorios, cremas corporales, cosméticos) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le hacen y así poder obtener mayor utilidad por venta, así mejorará sus ingresos y podrá ahorrar para cumplir su principal sueño a mediano plazo, que es montar un  almacén de variedades, que le permita generar más ingresos y brindarle un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Olga is 46 years of age, married, and the mother of three children. She used to be a housewife, but approximately four years ago she started to sell products by catalogue in order to obtain extra income and support her household. 

She sells perfumes, cosmetics, lingerie, accessories, and other things. Her main customers are relatives and friends. By doing this she has been able to generate income to contribute to her household. 

Olga is a woman with drive. She is enterprising and dedicated to her family, which is her main motivation in life. She is always going in search of opportunities which will allow them to prosper, and it is this which motivated her to request a loan with the goal of investing it in purchasing wholesale merchandise (perfume, lingerie, accessories, body creams, cosmetics) to take advantage of discounts and improve her income. By doing this she will be able to save towards accomplishing her main dream of setting up a variety store, which would allow her to generate more income and give her family a better quality of life and wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise wholesale (perfume, lingerie, accessories, body creams, cosmetics)

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is a 45-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Her husband provides services of whitewashing houses to his customers; sometimes he has to go out of city also. Her husband has to sit at the front of a paint dealer's shop so that he can easily find a new customer and sometimes he does not find any customer. 

Safina's husband got a new contract for whitewashing but he has no paint brush or rollers for whitewashing. Safina requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc.

Her husband’s income is very low and  that is why her family pass their lives in miserable conditions. Safina wants to change the living conditions of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy paint brushes, rollers and gallons of whitewash.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicken food.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is 55 years old, married, and has two children. Fadel and his elder child provide the family income together.  Fadel is a carpenter. In his workshop, he specializes in making bedrooms, living rooms, chairs, and tables. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field since he used to work at several workshops as an employee. In 2012, Fadel established his own business and now has two employees. Fadel’s fame grew fast in the neighborhood and has gained an excellent reputation, thanks to his wide experience in this field. 

Fadel is requesting a loan for $1,800, which he will use to buy a specialized piece of equipment for cutting wood. Fadel is aiming to provide his family with better living standards by continuously improving the quality of his products and expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase a specialized piece of equipment for cutting wood

loans.name: Milena María

texts.es: Milena, con 30 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercancía y productos por catálogo, ofrece cosméticos, accesorios, ropa, perfumes, entre otros y con esto ha logrado obtener recursos para aportar al sostenimiento de su hogar durante los tres años que lleva realizando dicha actividad. Es una mujer emprendedora, con visión, dedicada y comprometida con su familia y su trabajo, siempre busca oportunidades que le permitan progresar, por esa razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, cremas corporales, cosméticos, shampoo, tratamientos capilares) para aprovechar los descuentos que le realizan y ofrecer más variedad que satisfaga los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y así poder tener mejor margen de utilidad por las ventas. De esta manera, Milena podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su objetivo primordial, que es ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dos pequeños hijos, brindándoles una estabilidad económica favorable para darles la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Milena, 30, is mother to two children and lives in a free union with her partner. She sells catalog merchandise such as cosmetics, accessories, clothing, perfume, and more. She has managed to earn income to support her family during the three years she has been doing this work. She is enterprising, forward-looking, dedicated, and committed to her family and job. She always looks for chances to do better. 

Milena has applied for a loan to buy wholesales merchandise (perfume, body lotions, cosmetics, shampoo, and hair treatments) to take advantage of discounts and offer more variety to meet her customers' needs and desires. This will raise her gross margin on sales, and Milena will be able to take a step toward completing her main goals: growing her business and improving the standard of living for her two small children, which will bring her the financial stability necessary to give them the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy wholesales merchandise (perfume, body lotions, cosmetics, shampoo, and hair treatments)

loans.name: Janja

texts.en:
Janja is 45 years old and has been divorced for a long time. She has no children and lives alone. Currently, she is working as cleaner in a minority community where she also lives. She is a regular client of KosInvest. Now, for the third time, she is requesting a loan in order to put a facade her very old house and renovate the toilet.

This loan will help improve her living conditions and save money on utility costs, which will then in turn ensure financial security for her future. In the near future, she is hoping to get married. Janja is very happy for this opportunity and she thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to put a facade on her very old house and renovate the toilet.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 33 years old, married, and has two children. He is the only provider of the family. Khaled owns a general store where he sells basic electrical supplies such as bulbs and other supplies such as duct tapes. He has been in this field since 2009 and has been gradually expanding his experience. Khaled has one employee and has earned the respect of his neighborhood.

Khaled is requesting a loan for $2,400, which he will use to install an external ceiling and a rolling shutter for his general store. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his children with a bright future by educating them and giving them the best in everything.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling and a rolling shutter for his general store

loans.name: Marta Liliam

texts.es:
Marta es originaria de la linda ciudad de Estelí desde hace mucho años su estado civil es casada sus hijos ya son independiente de manera que le apoyan económicamente. Su oficio es confección de ropa  en su casa de habitación un trabajo que aprendió desde hace mucho tiempo  y que cada día le motiva más realizar este trabajo.

solicita un crédito a ceprodel para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento, cerámica, inodoro, lavamanos esto para instalar servicio de agua y saneamiento en su vivienda.

Doña Marta manifiesta que se siente alegre y apoyada por kiva ya que de esta manera podrá mejorar su vivienda con la instalación de servicio sanitario y también expreso que le gusta este proyecto porque tiene como objetivo reducir la contaminación ambiental.
texts.en: Marta is from the beautiful city of Estelí where she has lived for many years.  She is married and her children, who are already independent, support her financially.  Her business is making clothing and she works in her home.  She learned this job a long time ago and every day she is more motivated to do this job.  She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to purchase building materials such as sand, cement, and ceramic tile as well as a toilet and washbasin to install water and sanitation in her home.  Marta says that she feels happy for Kiva’s support because in this way, she will be able to improve her home by installing sanitation service.  She also says that she is pleased with this project because her goal is to reduce environmental contamination.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to install water and sanitation services.

loans.name: Susy Marlene

texts.es: La Sra. Susy tiene 27 años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona de Plan 3000,  es cliente que se encuentra en su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Susy va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un  horno de mayor capacidad ya que el que tiene le quedo muy chico ya que incremento sus ventas, La Sra. Susy es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Sra. Susy is 27-years old.  She makes her living making and selling bread.  Her bakery is located in the Plan 3000 zone.  She is in her first lending cycle with the Institution.  Sra. Susy is going to use this loan to purchase a larger capacity oven, as the one she has is too small to accommodate her increased sales.  Sra. Susy is a person who wants to keep improving her situation.  She feels happy about and grateful to the Institution for the assistance she has been offered, as this business is her only way of supporting herself.

loans.use: to purchase a larger capacity oven.

loans.name: Mia

texts.en:
This is Mia. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy more products and ingredients which resulted in higher income. She was able to support her children in school, and her household's everyday expenses. She and her husband are continuously working to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to purchase bananas, sugar, charcoal, oil, milk, and other ingredients for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs, and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mia dreams of becoming more successful in business, and hopes to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for bananas, sugar, charcoal, oil, milk and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Zivorad

texts.en:
Zivorad is married and has one adult child. He lives in a village in one of the minority communities in Kosovo. 

He does receive a pension from the government, but he continues to work in the agricultural field.  Zivorad has been keeping a cow, horses, and pigs for many years now, as well as growing wheat and corn on his land. He then sells the harvests from his land, and the dairy products and meats from his animals in order to make a living; the main source of income is from the cow’s milk production. 

Zivorad started this business by selling milk in his neighborhood. “I am very satisfied with this business because I have reduced my family’s costs while increasing our income,” Zivorad has said. He also claims that he has been the only one who has financially supported his family through the years. 

Now his life has been greatly improved, and he is requesting a loan for the first time so that he may purchase additional cows, expand his business and save money for his family’s future. 

He is aware that without the Kiva lenders, his goal will be difficult to achieve. Zivorad is very appreciative for the help.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Flor De Cardamomo Lancetillo Group

texts.es:
La señora Sarbelia es madre soltera, tiene 49 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 8 hijos y de ellos 2 estan estudiando, se dedica a vender comida en el mercado de su municipio, inició este negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo para el mantenimiento de su familia, hasta la fecha lleva 20 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para poder preparar mas comida ya que tiene demanda, desea en el futuro ampliar su capital de trabajo y vender más. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la cosecha de cardamomo. En la foto figuran 17 personas pero, de ellas solo se le concedió el préstamo a 10.
texts.en:
Sra. Sarbelia is an unmarried mother. She is 49 years old and finished six years of her primary school education. Sarbelia has eight children, two of whom are studying. She sells food at the municipal market.

Sarbelia started this business out of necessity because she wanted to help her husband with supporting their family. To this point, she has 20 years of experience.

Sarbelia organized a group so that she could request a loan. The money will be used to buy supplies for preparing more dishes that are in demand. In the future, she would like to increase her operating capital so that she can sell more.

The other members of the group engage in growing cardamom. The photo shows 17 members, but only 10 of them are participating in this loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Es Grande Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal  “El Esfuerzo Es Grande” está conformada por 10 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables que en el transcurso del tiempo han ido mejorando a través  de sus negocios. Este es el caso de Noymi de 48 años casada con 02 hijos  01 de ellos aún dependiente. Actualmente cuenta con una tienda en su vivienda la cual poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo ha podido implementarlo. Se siente feliz pues gracias a ello puede colaborar con los gastos del hogar. El último crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra abarrotes y bebidas. El deseo de Noymi es seguir implementando su negocio. El grupo “El Esfuerzo Es Grande” está agradecido con el crédito brindado, pues le permite progresar. Noymi se encuentra en la parte posterior es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa color negro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Esfuerzo Es Grande” (The Effort Is Great) consists of 10 enterprising and responsible women. Over the course of time, they have been able to improve their businesses.

Such is the case with Noymi. She is 48 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is still a dependent. Noymi has store in her home which she has established gradually and with great effort. She is pleased that her business has enabled her to contribute to the household expenses. The latest loan she has requested will be used to buy groceries and beverages. Noymi’s wish is to continue operating her business.

The group “El Esfuerzo Es Grande” appreciates the loan that has been provided since it will allow them to make progress. In the photo, Noymi is standing in the back in the third position. She is wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy groceries and beverages.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 63 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de pisco, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y por poseer playas hermosas.   Pedro desde muy joven tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, debido a ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería agrónoma.  Día a día Pedro trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, negocio con el cual pude tener ingresos y poder sacar adelante a su familia y sobre todo a su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad, al que quiere mucho y por el cual se sacrifica para poder darle mejores oportunidades que las que el tubo.

Pedro está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar fierros, arena, entre otros, y así poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda, con lo cual mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construír su vivienda y poder darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Pedro is 63 years old.  He lives in Pisco, a city characterized by a warm climate and beautiful beaches.  From a very young age, Pedro needed to work to support his parents.  For this reason, he only completed up to the fifth grade of secondary school.  However, he would have liked to study for a degree in agricultural engineering.  Day by day, Pedro works in his small business selling groceries, a business that enables him to earn income and get his family ahead, especially his little four year old son.  He loves his son very much and makes sacrifices to provide him with better opportunities than he had.

Pedro is very grateful for the Kiva loans thanks to the great support they have provided, he will be able to buy iron, sand, and other materials to make home improvements, which will improve his family’s quality of life.  He will also continue striving to be able to make his greatest dream a reality: “To finish building his home and be able to provide his son with a good education”.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Martha Lucía

texts.es:
Martha madre de familia, ha trabajo toda su vida en el campo de la confección, lo que le ha dado el impulso para crear su propia empresa, quien en un principio empezó con servicios de confección a terceros, ahora maneja su propia línea de ropa, sin dejar atrás la confección como proveedor.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una maquinaria plana, arreglar varias máquinas que están defectuosas, insumos y capital para una operaria adicional
Este crédito le permitirá un mejor rendimiento en su trabajo y crecer su propia línea de ropa. Anhelando que la empresa se fortalezca y perdure en el tiempo
texts.en:
Martha, the mother of a family, has been a tailor for her whole life. This gave her the idea to start her own business, which in the beginning offered tailoring services to third parties. Now, she manages her own line of clothing, while still offering tailoring services.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of a tabletop sewing machine and the repair of some broken machines, and supplies and capital to hire another worker.

This loan will allow her to improve her performance and grow her own clothing line. She hopes that the business will strengthen and last for a long time.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine and supplies, and to fix broken machines.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is from Iraq. He is 65 years old, married, and has two children. Both Adnan and his two children take part in the providing of the family living.

Regardless of his age, Adnan is a very active person. He owns a small workplace where he sells cereals and grains. He is both a wholesaler and a retailer. Adnan established his business in 1995 and has been in the market for a long time. He has gained much experience in this field and now he has an employee hired. Adnan is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

Adnan is requesting a loan of USD 2,400 in order to install signage and an external ceiling for his workplace. Adnan is aiming to continue providing the living of his family by expanding his business and is hoping that this loan will attract more customers to him, which will result in the increase of his profits.

loans.use: to install signage and an external ceiling for his workplace.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: La Sra. Marcela tiene 20 años, ella se dedica a la  venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra   en su mismo domicilio que es por la zona de Alto Chijini,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Marcela utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida como papa, arroz y fideo al por mayor  y así de esta manera mejorar sus ventas e incrementar su capital de trabajo su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos, la Sra. Marcela va a utilizar los beneficios para tomar en anticrético un ambiente para la venta de comida,  su deseo de la Sra. Marcela es crecer en su negocio, es una persona trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Marcela is 20 years old. She sells food from a stall that is located in her own home, in the Alto Chijini area. This is her first loan from Emprender. 

Marcela will use this loan to buy ingredients used to make her food, such as potatoes, rice and noodles wholesale. In this way she will increase her sales and her working capital. The reason she needs this loan is the lack of working capital to buy ingredients. She will use the revenue to pay the "anticretico" (a payment of money in exchange for one years rent) on a place to sell her food. Marcela's wish is to expand her business. She is a hard-working person and feels grateful to Emprender for the help in granting this loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her food.

loans.name: Cadith

texts.es: Cadith, de 50 años, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia y es a ellos a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Cadith se dedica a la tapicería. Trabaja en la elaboración o refacción de asientos y toldos de vehículos como motos y mototaxis. Tiene un local en su casa en donde funciona su negocio desde hace 10 años. Ella se encarga del corte y la costura de las piezas que luego son colocadas en los vehículos. Cuenta con la ayuda de un obrero y eventualmente de una de sus hijas. También alquila diariamente un mototaxi recibiendo un pago establecido al culminar la jornada de trabajo. Desea seguir adelante para surgir a lado de su familia y ahora más que nada por que sera abuela dentro de poco . Lo que le gusta de su labor es el ingreso económico que percibe a diario lo cual le permite hacer rotar su dinero con mayor fluidez, le esta yendo bien y espera poder mantener el mismo horizonte de trabajo hasta que se consolide y pueda implementar su local con mejores equipos y máquinas de coser para mejorar la atención de sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 4000, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales para tapicería, entre ellos esponjas, agujas especiales, hilos, lonas, triplay, pegamentos y otros elementos que necesita para hacer su trabajo.
texts.en:
Cadith, 50, is a widow and has five children whom she lives with in her own home. She wants to give them a better quality of life. 

Cadith works doing upholstery. She works making and repairing seats and covers for vehicles like motorcycles and motortaxis. She has an establishment in her home where she has had her business for the past ten years. She takes care of cutting and sewing the pieces that are then places in the vehicles. She has help from a worker and occasionally one of her daughters. She also rents out a motortaxi daily, receiving a set payment at the end of every work day. 

She wants to continue moving forward to rise up along with her family and now more than ever because she will soon be a grandmother. What she likes about the work is her daily income which means she can turn over her money with greater ease. It is going well for her and she can maintain the same work in the the future she can consolidate and outfit her establishment with better equipment and sewing machines to improve customer service. This time, she is asking for S/4000. She is grateful to those who make her access to financing possible, which makes her more certain of moving forward with her work. She promises to make her payments on time. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy materials for upholstery, among them foam, special needles, thread, canvas, plywood, glue, and other things that she needs to do her work.

loans.use: to buy materials like foam, special needles, thread, canvas, and plywood, among other things.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La señora Sandra tiene 41 años, es divorciada y tiene 2 hijas mayores. La Sra. Sandra tiene una Aguatería, desde hace 22 años, comenta que compro la aguatería y en aquel entonces solo contaba con 10 usuarios, luego fue invirtiendo y agrandando su red de distribución y actualmente tiene 180 usuarios.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que esta luchando, esta contenta porque por medio de su aguatería puede hacer llegar a las personas algo tan importante como es el agua, ya que es algo vital para todo ser humano.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el Mantenimiento de motores y bombas, reparación y cambios de caños averiados de la red de cañerías, con lo cual podrá seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus usuarios.
texts.en:
Sandra, 41, is divorced and has two adult daughters.  Sandra has had a water distribution firm called Villa Adriana for the last 22 years.  She comments that back then when she bought it only had ten users but she started investing in it and extending her distribution grid and at present has 180 users.

She’s a very hardworking woman who is struggling but happy because by means of her water distribution firm she can make something as important as water which is something vital to all human beings reach people.

She’s requesting this loan today to invest in motor and pump maintenance and to repair and replace damaged pipes in the water grid with which she’ll succeed in providing good service to her users.

loans.use: to repair motors, water pumps and to repair and replace pipes.

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
Paula emprendedora de 30 años le ha gustado mucho el área de la belleza y es por ello que desde muy joven se ha capacitado y ha aprendido a realizar diversos peinados y arreglos de uñas, en estos momentos afianza y pone en práctica todos sus conocimientos adquiridos en su nuevo negocio de belleza, realizando domicilios para sus clientes con servicios de alta calidad y destacándose en cepillado de cabello dama, manicure y pedicura.
Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos (tinturas y tratamientos), y en la compra de instrumentos los cuales le ayudara al crecimiento del negocio.
texts.en:
Paula is a thirty-year-old entrepreneur who is very interested in the beauty sector. Thus, since very young she has been undergoing training and learning how to do different hairstyles and manicures. She puts all her knowledge into practice in her new beauty business, visiting her clients in their homes and providing high quality services. She specializes in ladies' hairstyles, manicure, and pedicure.

She wishes to expand her business by purchasing inputs (dyes and treatments) and tools, which will help her to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy inputs and tools

loans.name: Melany

texts.es: Melany, a sus 18 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja. Hace 3 meses, en compañía de su pareja tomó la iniciativa de comenzar el negocio de comercialización de muebles y colchones, con unos ahorros que tenían. Ninguno de los dos ha tenido asesoría o capacitación en este negocio y hasta el momento lo han manejado y han aprendido por prueba / error. Melany es una joven activa, enérgica y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, por esta razón se motiva para solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de herramientas de trabajo (pistola remachadora neumática, un circular, una máquina ensambladora de bases) y materia prima al por mayor (madera, clavos, remaches, cuero, entre otros) con el fin de tener variedad de insumos que le permitan satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y fabricar sus propios diseños para entregar un producto terminado de buena calidad. Con esto podrá mejorar sus ingresos para  alcanzar el sueño de tener una galería, en un local propio y así generar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Melany, 18, is in a common law relationship.  Three months ago she and her spouse decided to start a business selling furniture and mattresses using some savings they had.  Neither of them has had any assessment or business training and to date they’ve managed it and have learned by trial and error.

Melany is an active, energetic young woman who very much wants to get ahead which is why she’s motivated to request the loan to buy work tools (a pneumatic staple gun, a circular saw and a base-assembling machine) and also raw materials at wholesale (lumber, nails, staples, leather, etc.) in order to have a variety of supplies so customer needs can be met and to manufacture her own designs and deliver a quality finished product.  With this she will be able to improve he income and reach her dream of owning a store in a space of her own thus generating better quality of life and well-being for her family.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Aura Rosa

texts.es: Aura, es una señora de 64 años y tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos tiene problemas y se le recomendó recurrir a un centro de rehabilitación, la señora Aura solicito un crédito de $ 400.000 para la compra de sandalias, recipientes plásticos y bolsas que es lo con lo que genera el sustento para su familia, ella trabaja aproximadamente 15 horas cada día, en un puesto transitorio de 2am a 5pm, es una mujer muy luchadora con ganas de salir adelante; y con esto poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Aura, 64, has three children. One of them has problems and it was recommended that he turn to a rehab center.  Aura requested a 400.000 loan to buy sandals, plastic containers and bags which are what generate income for family support.  She works in a portable stand for approximately 15 hours a day, from 2am-5am.  She’s a very hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead and to be able to expand her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy sandals, plastic containers and bags.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is 43 years old and lives alone in Sevan city which is in Gegharkunik region. She sells fruits and vegetables, which she has been doing for 10 years. She manages her business at the food market where she rents a small stall and sells large variety of fruits (apples, plums, peaches, and bananas) and vegetables (beans, potatoes, cabbage, onions, peppers, greens, etc.). 

Arevik is requesting a loan for 500,000 Armenian drams, which she will use to buy fruits and vegetables for her trading business, so that she always has a fresh assortment at her stall.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables
