La señora Fermina tiene la edad de 48 años, solo estudio la primaria y se encuentra casada con el señor Cristino Con el cual tuvo dos hijos, actualmente ellos son mayores de edad y trabajan, ella platica que desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar para salir adelante y cuando se caso inicio a realizar pequeñas ventas para ganar su propio dinero y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano para dama y caballero, ella realiza sus ventas de casa en casa con sus amigos, vecinos y el las comunidades cercanas, también platica que como ya es conocida en su comunidad algunas veces le hacen pedidos o cuando se surte avisa a sus clientes y acuden a sus casa a hacerle el gasto.

ella también una o dos veces  por semana organiza una venta de tamales  para obtener un ingreso extra. 

ella ha solicitado este credito a vision fund ya que quiere invertirlo en la compra de variedad de camisas, blusas, playeras, shorts, pantalones y ropa interior.

ella espera en un futuro continuar invirtiendo para aumentar sus ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Los Soñadores agradecen el prestamo y la confianza que Vision Fund les ha brindado
texts.en:
"Los Soñadores" is the name of this six-member group - all the entrepreneurs here are happy and enterprising.  Each one has their own business:  Inés sells cattle; Fermina sells clothes and tamales; Glafira rents out a tractor and harvester;  María del Rocío sells fizzy drinks and chicken; Blanca Nery sells clothes; and Juventino makes a living as a taxi driver.  This group can be found in the sugar-growing region, where the main source of income is from working in the field, sowing and growing sugar cane.

Fermina is 48 years old.  She completed only primary school and is now married to Cristino, with whom she has two children.  Both their children are now working adults.  Fermina tells us that, from a young age, her parents taught her to work in order to get ahead.  When she married, she began making small sales so as to earn her own money and to support her husband with the household costs.  She currently makes a living selling second-hand clothes for men and women.  Fermina sells from door-to-door, to friends, neighbours and nearby communities.  She also tells us that she is now known in her town, with people sometimes making orders.  When she has leftover stock, Fermina lets her customers now and they come round to her house to buy clothes.

Once or twice a week Fermina also goes out to sell tamales in order to make a little extra money.

Fermina is applying for a loan from "Vision Fund" as she wants to invest in a variety of shirts, blouses, beach shoes, shorts, trousers and underwear. 

In the future she hopes to continue investing in order to increase her profits and improve her quality of life.

The "Los Soñadores" group is grateful for this loan and the trust that "Vision Fund" has put in its members.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, beach shoes, shorts, trousers and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock containers of cleaning products: bleach, Pino (disinfectant), Suavitel (washing detergent), Fabuloso (cleaning detergent)

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico is married with two children who are of school age. He is 38 years old and lives in Lambojon, Siquijor, Siquijor.

Rico sells motorcycle spare parts to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, he earns PHP 20,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for PHP 40,000 to use in purchasing motorcycle spare parts.

Rico has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rico hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman and has five children. Three of her children go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a kiosk business, and her major challenge is seasonality.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase maize flour, cooking oil, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, cooking oil, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old, single and has three daughters. Elizabeth is a very caring mother. Her first goal is to give her children a good life. For that, Elizabeth is working every day without rest. 

She sells wax-print. Her profit in this business is GHS 100 monthly, but that is not enough to take care of her children and to buy goods for her store. She is also very worried about giving her daughters a good education.

She has a sample of the wax-print clothing in hand in the photograph.

Now needs a loan amount of GHS 2,800. With this money, she plans to bring more wax-print to the store and increase her sales. She has already taken eight loans from ID-Ghana in the past. 

Elizabeth is very optimistic about this business, and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to bring more wax-print to the store and increase her sales.

loans.name: Lamzira

texts.en:
Lamzira is 42 years old and lives in the Abasha district with her husband and a daughter. The family is involved in the agricultural business and cultivates a plot of land where nuts and maize are grown. They sell the harvest at the local open market. 

Besides the agricultural activities, Lamzira works at the local municipality, and her husband is a decorator. Both of the family members get small monthly salaries. The total amount of the income is approximately 150 USD per month. As their existing revenue is very small and is not enough to cover everyday expenses, Lamzira decided to start up a clothing sales business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Lamzira’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn’t satisfy their requirements. 

She received this credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Start-up Program, which gives vulnerable poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With this loan of 300 GEL, she will purchase clothing at wholesale prices at the capital city open market and sell it in her community door-to-door. Her regular customers will be her friends and neighbors. She plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women and children. It is obvious that the job is hard for Lamzira, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. 

The start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased, thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start up a clothing sales business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 50 years old and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Vivian has a store that sells a variety of products, such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others.  She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan of 14,900 pesos to buy additional inventory for sale.

Vivian has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, she hopes to own enough savings deposits for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for sale.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Doña Gladis tiene 52 años de edad con las cuales ha visto en lo largo de su vida crecer a sus 7 hijos en un matrimonio sólido, luchador y hoy en día a sus nietos. Con 3 años de educación primaria y una gran familia ella trabaja la tierra el cultivo de café ya que con ella vive uno de sus hijos su nuera y sus 2 nietos por los cuales le da gracias a DIOS por tenerlos sanos y fuertes. Ella también se dedica a la elaboración y venta de viveros de café ya que durante 30 años gracias al apoyo de sus padres que fueron quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra los elabora para su venta y siembra por lo cual en su familia la agricultura es una tradición. La tierra que ella en compañía de su familia trabaja es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está ubicada a 5 minutos de su casa de habitación por lo cual se le hace fácil el mantenimiento y asistencia.

Ella ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos como: fertilizantes, abono, foliares, formula cafetalera, etc. para sus cultivos y viveros de café con lo cual los mantendrá sanos y estarán protegidos para la cosecha y venta.

Sus planes con esta solicitud son los de posteriormente obtener una buena cosecha para poder generar ganancias y re invertir en sus cultivos de café, arreglar su casa de habitación y ampliar más sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Doña Gladis is 52-years old.  During the course of her life, she has seen seven children grow in her solid, determined marriage.  And now she watches her grandchildren grow as well.  With three years of primary education and a large family, doña Gladis works the land.  She grows coffee, as one of her sons, her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren live with her.  She gives thanks to GOD that they are healthy and strong.  Doña Gladis also grows and sells coffee plants from her nursery.  Thanks to her parents' help (they taught her how to work the land), for thirty years she has been able to grow and sell the nursery plants.  For her, agriculture is a family tradition.  The land that doña Gladis works together with her family is hers thanks to an inheritance from her parents.  It is located about five minutes from her house, which makes it easy to maintain and tend to. 

Doña Gladis has requested a loan from COMIXMUL which she will use to purchase supplies such as: fertilizers, compost, nutrients, coffee grower's formula etc. for her crop and her coffee nursery.  These items will keep her plants healthy and protected for the harvest and sale. 

With the requested loan, doña Gladis plans to be able to have a good harvest, which will generate earnings.  She will re-invest her earnings in her coffee plants, fix up her house and expand her crops.

loans.use: with the purchase of agricultural supplies for her crops and her coffee nursery.

location.town: San Jose de la Cuesta, Siguatepeque

loans.name: Asdeqa Bihan Group

texts.en: This group is called Asdeqa Bihan and consists of three women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have requested a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB. Among the borrowers is Lamisa, age 26, who is a hard-working homemaker. Although her income is not very consistent, she does what she can to provide for the family. She intends to buy home improvements to use for her house. She has requested a youth loan in the amount of 70,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a washing machine and T.V. for her home. She hopes to improve her living standards in order to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and T.V. for her home.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Bernard who produces some additional income for the family and they have two children aged 15 and 8 years old.

She has a shop where she sells shoes and belts and she has been in this business for the past three years. She has applied for a third loan from Kadet Ltd which she plans to use for buying more shoes and belts for her business.

She hopes to have a very bright future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and belts for her business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 60 years old and lives in Dao-an, San Miguel, ZDS. She is married with two children.

Rosita has a shop that sells groceries. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of twenty thousand pesos to purchase grocery products.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her sari-sari (general store) business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store.

location.town: Pagadian - San Miguel. Zambo. del Sur

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with four children. She is 46 years old and lives in P6, Pines, Oroquieta City.

Helen has a sari-sari store and owns a little parcel of rice land to earn a living; she has had this business for one year & 5 years, respectively. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan 5,000 PHP to buy farm inputs and fertilizer.

Helen has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Helen hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Dalias Group

texts.es: Ángel tiene 23 años de edad, es originario de la comunidad de San Felipe de los Alzati donde la principal fuente de empleo es la artesanía en barro y la producción de flores de noche buena, Ángel por primera vez entro a un grupo llamado Dalias, dice que una amiga de su mama lo invito y como ve que es trabajador y cumplido decidió invitarlo y también porque él quiere invertir en su negocio de mantenimiento de motos, dice que él aprendió a darles servicio y mantenimiento porque un amigo le enseño el cual tenía un taller y el entro a trabajar con él cuando era pequeño, aparte de que a Ángel siempre le han gustado las motos y hace 8 años decidió poner su propio negocio ya que se caso y para poder mantener a su familia puso su propio taller, el vive en casa de su mama y ella le dio un pedazo de terreno para que pusiera su negocio y dice que le esta yendo bien ya que le está echando muchas ganas hacer las composturas bien para que así regresen los clientes y den buenas referencias de él. Dice que ahorita el esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de refacciones que ocupa para reparar las motos y comprar varias herramientas que ocupa, dice que si se lo prestan mejorara mucho su taller ya que un amigo le presta las herramientas pero el se quiere comprar las propias, agradece que hayan confiado en el para hacerle un crédito y que promete aprovecharlo. Los demás integrantes de su grupo se llaman Minerva, Rosalba, Leopoldo, Norma, Martina y Ana Laura, ellos invertirán sus créditos en sus diferentes negocios como tienda de abarrotes (en la cual se tomo la foto), en compra de ropa de segunda para su venta, en compra de colchas, sabanas, cobertores, edredones por catalogo, en la compra de material para elaborar prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Angel is 23 years old and comes from the community of San Felipe de los Alzati where the main source of employment is creating artisanal works out of clay and making Christmas Eve flowers. This is the first time that Angel has joined the Dalias group. He says that a friend of his mum saw that he was a reliable worker and knew that he wanted to invest in his business maintaining motorbikes, so she invited him to join. He says he learnt how to service and maintain motorbikes because a friend who had a workshop taught him how to do everything from when he was little. Apart from that, Angel has always liked motorbikes, so eight years ago he decided to start his own workshop since he got married and needed to support his family. Angel lives with his mum, who gave him a piece of land where he could set up his business. He says it is going well as he is putting a lot of effort into carrying out his repairs so that his customers will come back and recommend him. 

He says that he is applying for a loan now to buy spare parts and tools that he needs for his motorcycles. He says that if he receives this loan his workshop will improve since a friend lends him tools but he wants to buy his own. He is grateful to those who have put their trust in him to give him this loan and he promises to make the most of it.

The other members of the group are Minerva, Rosalba, Leopoldo, Norma, Martina and Ana Laura. They used their loans for different businesses including a grocery store (in which the photo is taken), the purchase of second hand clothes to resell, mattresses, sheets, covers, quilts from a catalogue and material to make handcrafted garments.

loans.use: to buy parts and tools to service the motorbikes he repairs

loans.name: Chalmita Ganaderia Group

texts.es: Sara tiene 26 años de edad, es originaria de una comunidad indígena la cual limita con el estado de México, llamada el Lindero, ella es madre de un niño pequeño el cual pronto entrara a la escuela, dice que está emocionada por que su hijo ya ira al preescolar, dice que aunque son muchos los gastos entre material que pidió la escuela y el uniforme pero que vale la pena todo po que su hijo tenga estudios para que cuando sea grande tenga un buen trabajo ya que el trabajo del campo es pesado. Ella pertenece a un grupo de personas el cual piden créditos para mejorar sus negocios y asi poder sacar algo de capital para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, su grupo se llama Chalmita ya que sus compañeras y ella son devotas del Santo señor de Chalma. Ella se dedica a criar borregos desde hace 2 años y dice que empezó con estén negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y también para ella tener un capital propio, dice que cuando tiene mejores ventas es en el mes de mayo- junio y diciembre en los dos primeros meses por que es cuando las escuelas hacen sus clausuras y los padres de familia hacen comida, fiestas para festejar a sus hijos que salieron de la escuela y en el mes de diciembre por que es el mes cuando son las fiestas del 24 de diciembre el día de la navidad y en año nuevo. Platica que le va bien con las ventas y que ahorita solicito un crédito por que comprara alimento para sus borregos que tiene los cuales son 7 que le quedaron de las ventas recientes que tubo, además quiere comprar una borrega para seguir criando pequeños borreguitos, también cría y vende guajolotes los cuales son más fáciles de cuidar que los borregos. Platica que los borregos se los compra a otras personas de su comunidad y ella los vende en su casa o hay veces que su esposo la lleva a la población de Zitacuaro donde se pone un tianguis de animales los días jueves y cuando ocupa un dinerito de urgencia va y vende sus borreguitos o los guajolotes. Agradece a Visión Fund por el crédito que le harán por que así mejorara su negocio. Las demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Cecilia, Esperanza y María Marcelina ellas invertirán en surtir una tienda de abarrotes y para la compra de borregos y alimento para estos.
texts.en:
Sara is 26 years old and is from an indigenous community called Lindero which is located in the state of México. She is the mother of one son who will soon begin school. She says that she is excited for her son to go to preschool. Although the costs are high between the materials that the school requests she purchase and the uniform required, she says that it is all worth it for her son to study so that when he is older he will have a good job because the work in the fields is very difficult. 

She belongs to a group when requests loans to improve their businesses in order to be able to get income and improve their living conditions. Her group is called Chalmita because she and her group members are followers of the holy saint of Chalma. She has been making a living over sheep for two years and says that she began this business to support her husband with the household expenses and also so that she can have her own income. She says that her sales are best during the months of May, June and December. During May and June it is because the schools are closing so the parents are making food and having parties to celebrate their children leaving school, and in December it is because of Christmas Eve, Christmas Day and New Year's celebrations. 

She comments that her sales are going well and she is now requesting a loan to buy food for her the seven sheep that remain from her recent sales. She also wants to buy a ewe to continue raising more lambs. She also raises and sells turkeys which are easier to care for than sheep. She buys the sheep from others in her community and she sells them from her home. Her husband also sometimes brings the sheep and turkey to sell in a community called Zitacuaro where an open air market is held on Thursdays when they need money more urgently. 

She is thankful to Visión Fund for the loan that is being given to her so that she can improve her business. The rest of the members of the group include Cecilia, Esperanza, and María Marcelina. They invest their loan amounts in a grocery store and to buy sheep and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy sheep and turkeys to raise and then sell, and to purchase food for the animals.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en: Luvuno appreciates on the loan she was given. She is now requesting a loan of sh.20000 that she will use for transportation of her fish to other markets for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell and to pay for transporting the fish.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is married with five children. Florida is 61 years old and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City.

Florida engaged in a sari-sari store (general store) to earn a living and has had this business for 13 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for Php 10,000 to buy soft drinks and other inventory for sale.

Florida has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, Florida hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and other inventory for sale.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is married with one child. Anecita is 46 years old and lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City.

Anecita engaged in a buy & sell business of junk items such as metals, plastics & bottles to earn a living, and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for Php 30,000 to buy junk items for sale.

Anecita has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Anecita hope to have more savings.

loans.use: to buy junk material to sell.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Consorcia is married with three children. She is 50 years old and lives in Dao Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Consorcia is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She requested a loan to buy feed for her pigs.

Consorcia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to build a big piggery so that she can raise more pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

location.town: Dao Pagadian City Zamboanga Del Sur Philippines

loans.name: Matamoros Group

texts.es:
Doña Ysidra una mujer muy alegre y emprendedora que hace 12 años decidió abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la cual emplearse para ganarse su propio dinero y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, ella comenta que se inclino por esta actividad porque siempre se vende no hay temporadas.

Su tienda de abarrotes se encuentra ubicada en su hogar lo cual le da la oportunidad de ganarse su propio dinero sin desetender sus labores del hogar.

Doña Ysidra solo estudio primaria y se encuentra casada.


este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, azúcar, café, sal, harinas, galletas, refrescos, dulces y productos enlatados para resurtir su negocio. 

ella espera que su negocio continué creciendo y cada día tener mas variedad de productos para atraer mas clientes y así aumentar sus ganancias.

ella es integrante de un grupo Llamado Matamoros el cual esta conformado por 8 mujeres emprendedoras,ellas decidieron dar este nombre a su grupo porque así se llama la calle donde se reúnen para hacer sus reuniones de pago y pensaron que seria mas fácil de identificarlas


los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Marisol venta de refrescos
Berenice estética
Narcisa venta de antojitos mexicanos
ignacia venta de refrescos
Aropajita venta de ropa
Rosa Aurora venta de antojitos mexicanos
Rosa venta de refrescos
texts.en:
Ysidra is a very happy and enterprising woman who decided to open her own grocery store where she works to earn her own money and help her husband with household costs. She says she likes this store because it’s not a seasonal business so she can sell all year round. Her grocery store is set up in her own home, which gives her the opportunity to make her own money without neglecting the household chores.

Ysidra only went to primary school and is married.

This loan will be used to purchase rice, beans, oil, soup, sugar, coffee, salt, flour, biscuits, soft drinks, sweets and canned products to re-stock her store. She hopes that her business can continue to grow so that every day she will have a greater variety of products to attract more customers and increase her profits.

Ysidra is a member of the Matamoros Group which is made up of eight enterprising women. They decided to name their group after the street where they meet to make their payments and also because they thought it would be easier to identify them that way.

The other members of the group are:

Marisol who sells soft drinks
Berenice who sells beauty products
Narcisa who sells Mexican snacks
ignacia who sells soft drinks
Aropajita who sells clothes
Rosa Aurora who sells Mexican snacks
Rosa who sells soft drinks

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, soup, sugar, coffee, salt, flour, biscuits, soft drinks, sweets and canned products

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is married with two children who are school-aged. Efren is 42 years old and lives in Candanay Norte, Siquijor. 

Efren is a tricycle driver and has done this activity for five years. Each month, he earns PHP 8,000.00 doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan for PHP 20,000.00 to use in purchasing additional supplies for his motorcycle. Efren has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Efren hopes to invest in this business.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Haind

texts.en: Haind is 21-year-old single woman who lives in Haja, Yemen. She didn't complete her studies. She is a housewife who tries to work hard. She suffers from a lack of money to buy home improvements. She applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine and refrigerator to use for her house. This will ensure a better future for her and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and refrigerator to use for her house.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman and has seven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food kiosk business. She faces a major challenge of competition from other kiosk operators.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase utensils, cooking oil and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, cooking oil and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, a 31-year-old married mother of four, lives in Dao Pagadian City Zamboanga Del Sur Philippines, where she has a vulcanizing shop and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month.

A member of PMPC for two years, Josephine has requested a loan to buy more materials for her shop. In the future, she hopes to buy more machines for her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more materials for their vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 60 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.
 
Leonila is engaged in a cocoa tablet and coffee processing and vending activity. She earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional cacao seeds and coffee beans to be processed for her existing business. 

Leonila has been a member of PMPC almost two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cacao seeds and coffee beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock like sugar, flour, paraffin, cooking oil and sweets for his retail shop.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is married with one child. He is 32 years old and lives in Nonoc, Larena, Siquijor.

Anthony sells different products, such as canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks and toothpaste to earn a living, and has had this business for four years. Each month, he earns PHP 8,500 doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to purchase different products, such as canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks and toothpaste.

Anthony is a new member of PMPC. In the future, he hopes to expand his business with this institution.

loans.use: to purchase different products, such as canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks and toothpaste.

loans.name: Union Y Amistad Group

texts.es: Lidia tiene 30 años es originaria de una comunidad indígena llamada Macho de Agua la cual colinda con el Estado de México, en esta localidad se encuentra una oficina de Visión Mundial el cual ayudan a niños de bajos recursos a que tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Lidia tiene dos niños a los cuales están patrocinados en Visión Mundial y dice que gracias a esta organización sus hijos viven en mejores condiciones, están al pendiente de su alimentación, salud y educación esta ultima para ser personas productivas para su comunidad y para su país, además que ha Lidia le dan capacitaciones para que pueda tener un negocio estable.  Ella desde hace 8 años tiene un negocio de cría y venta de puercos, su esposo le hizo varios chiqueros para tener sus animales en buenas condiciones, platica que decidió vender puercos porque en su comunidad casi nadie vende, es por eso que ella se animo, además que son fáciles de alimentar, platica que su esposo le ayuda a venderlos ya que se los lleva en una camioneta a venderlos a una población donde hay un tianguis cada jueves y ahí los ofrece en ventas. Dice que hay dos meses al año que es cuando vende un poco mas que es en junio por las clausuras de las escuelas y en diciembre que es por las fiestas decembrinas de la navidad y el año nuevo. Comenta que  también en su pueblo ya le van a comprar hasta su casa y que tiene tres puercas grandes que son las que dan las crías y vende todas sus crías y ella se queda con las grandes, también tiene un semental que también ese no lo vende. Ahorita Lidia está pidiendo un crédito para comprar alimentos, vacunas para los animales para mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, ella pertenece a un grupo llamado Unión y Amistad el cual ya van varios ciclos que trabajan juntos y dice que les va muy bien en sus negocios. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Ofelia, Marisol, Fabián y Gilberta ellos invertirán en sus negocios como en una huerta de aguacates, en una cooperativa escolar, en medicamentos para una farmacia, en ropa para bebes y mujeres.
texts.en:
Lidia is 30-years old.  She is a native of an indigenous community called Macho de Agua, which adjoins the State of México.  An office for Visión Mundial there helps low-income children to have a better quality of life.  Lidia has two children who are sponsored by Visión Mundial, and she says that thanks to this organization her children live in better conditions.  They are watchful of their nutrition, health and education so they can be productive members of their community and their country.  In addition, Lidia gets training on how to have a stable business.  She decided eight years ago to have a business raising and selling pigs.  Her husband made her a number of pens so she could keep her pigs in good conditions.  She says that she decided to sell pigs because in her community nobody was doing so.  And so she got excited about it.  In addition, the pigs are easy to feed.  She says that her husband helps her to sell them, as he takes them in a pick-up truck to a town where there are street markets every Thursday.  He sells them there.  She says that there are two months a year that she sells a bit more, which are June- because of the school closings- and December- because of the December Christmas celebrations and the New Year.  She also says that in her town, people come to her house to buy pigs.  She has three big pigs which are the ones that give offspring, so she keeps the big ones.  She also has a stud, which she doesn't sell.  Right now Lidia is asking for a loan to purchase animal feed and inoculations for the animals to keep them in the best possible condition. 
Lidia belongs to a communal bank called "Unión y Amistad" (Union and Friendship) which has been working together for various cycles.  She says that they are doing well in their businesses.  The other members are Ofelia, Marisol, Fabián and Gilberta.  They will invest in their businesses, which are an avocado garden, a school cooperative, medications for a pharmacy and clothing for babies and women.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and inoculations for pigs.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Mamadou est un homme de 40 ans,marié et père de 04 enfants. il fait dans la vente des chaussures dans un marché de la pce depuis 06 ans.compte tenu de la forte demande,il est confronté à un problème constant de orupture de stock et son chiffre d'affaire oscille selon les périodes. c'est la raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock de chaussures et diversifier sa marchandise en achetant des habits. ce crédit lui permettra de satisfaire la demande des clients et et de réaliser les bénéfices.lesquels l'aiderontà réliser ses projets tels:ouvrir un atelier de couture. de même il aimerait satisfaire les besoins de sa famille en envoyant ses enfants à l'école.
texts.en: Mamadou is a 40-year old man, married and the father of four. He has been working as a shoe vendor at a flea market for six years. Given the high demand, he constantly runs out of stock and his earnings fluctuate a lot. This is why he is seeking a loan to bolster his shoe stock and diversify his merchandise by purchasing some clothing too. This loan will allow him to meet customer demand and make a profit, which will be used for his future projects, such as opening a tailor shop. He would also like to provide for his family and pay for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to bolster his shoe stock and diversify his merchandise.

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.en:
Eleazar is married with two children. Eleazar is 56 years old and lives in Nailon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Eleazar sells "balut" (a common street food in the Philippines) to earn a living and has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan to purchase additional duck eggs and for other balut sauce ingredients such as vinegar, garlic, ginger, etc.

Eleazar has been a member of PMPC for four months. In the future, Eleazar hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for balut sauce such as vinegar, garlic, ginger, etc.

loans.name: Asatu

texts.en:
29-year-old Asatu from Liberia lives in Logan Town, one of the early and well-known communities in Liberia. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have four children between the ages of 11 and 2; only three are presently in school and live at home. Asatu stopped her education at fourth grade.

For the past five years she has been running a business where she sells cement out of a forty-foot container. She started this business by selling on a table in a market and later received money from her husband to increase her inventory, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she makes more profit every day and it keeps her busy. Most interestingly, she learned the different kinds of local languages.

She is requesting a 100,000 LRD loan to purchase more cement for her business. Her plan is to educate her children. She appreciates BRAC Liberia and the lenders who support them.

loans.use: to purchase more cement for her business.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is married with 3 children. She is 53 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Constancia operates her sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP per month. She has requested a loan of 14900 PHP for additional capital.

Constancia has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Constancia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: for additional capital to buy more groceries to sell.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: G.s El Tular Group

texts.es:
El señor Rafael de 57 años  de edad,  vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos  mayores en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 25  años al negocio de venta de maíz, leña, fertilizantes por libra y por quintal.
Don Rafael  se dedica a la agricultura es un hombre serio, trabajador y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, el grupo solidario El tular ha decidido que él sea el líder ya que es la persona que tiene carisma con los demás.
Don Rafael  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de fertilizantes e insumos para agricultura y  al igual que sus compañeros de grupo están contentos de trabajar con Prisma.
Doña Mary tiene negocio de pulpería la cual desea surtir un poco.
Doña Luwin tiene un negocio de venta de leña. 
Don Rafael  su sueño es tener una buena cosecha este año y  tener una mejor casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
Rafael, 57 years old, lives with his wife and his two adult children in his home.  He has worked for 25 years in the business of selling corn, firewood and fertilizers by the pound and by the quintal.  Rafael makes a living in agriculture and is a serious, hardworking man who is eager to get ahead.  The solidarity group El Tular has decided that he will be the leader since he is the person that has charisma with others.

Rafael is requesting the loan for the purchase of fertilizers and supplies for agriculture and just like his colleagues in the group he is happy to work with Prisma.  Mary has a convenience store which she wants to stock a little bit.  Luwin has a business selling firewood. 

Rafael’s dream is to have a good harvest this year and have a better house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – July 2013.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supplies for his business.

loans.name: G.s Alto Verde Group

texts.es:
El señor Abel  de 31  años  de edad,  vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 03  años al negocio de venta de baleadas, frescos naturales y agua.
Don Abel con esta actividad él y su esposa han sacado adelante a su familia y han mejorado su condición de vida, están luchando por ampliar su negocio y sus compañeros del grupo denominado alto verde se sienten muy bien al nombrarlo como líder ya que es una persona seria y responsable.
Don Abel está solicitando el préstamo para compra de papas, yuca, pataste, plátanos, harina, soda, frutas,  frescos de botella, carnes y aceites ya que  junto con su esposa desean además de vender baleadas, también quieren vender otro tipo de golosinas para aumentar más sus ingresos y de esa forma ir saliendo adelante.
Don Luis su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Doña Claudia tiene un negocio de venta de ropa al por mayor, en las fotos se muestra el negocio de cada uno de ellos. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013
texts.en:
Abel, 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in their house.  For the past 3 years, he has made his living selling baleadas (flour tortilla folded in half with refried beans, cheese, cream and other ingredients inside), fruit drinks and water.  With this business, Abel and his wife have gotten their family ahead and have improved their living conditions.  They are struggling to expand their business.  

His colleagues of the group called Alto Verde are very happy to have named him as their leader, since he is a serious and responsible person.

Abel is applying for this loan to buy potatoes, yucca, chayote squash, plantains, flour, soda, fruits, bottled soft drinks meats and oils, since he and his wife want to sell other types of snacks, in addition to selling baleadas, in order to increase their income and in this way, get ahead.

Luis' business is selling clothes.  Claudia has a business selling wholesale clothing.  The photos show each person's business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2013

loans.use: to buy potatoes, yucca, chayote squash, plantains, flour, soda, fruits, bottled soft drinks, meats and oils for his business.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is married and has no children. Florida is 57 years old and lives in Candanay Norte, Siquijor, Siquijor. 

Florida has been raising hogs for almost 15 years and earns approximately PHP 2,000.00 a month. She requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 to buy feed and piglets. 

Florida is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Florida hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 48 years old and lives in Dao Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Lorna has a tailoring shop and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to buy more cloth, thread, and other materials needed for her business.

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to buy more machines for her tailoring shop.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to make rugs, pot holders, and slippers.

location.town: PAgadian - Dao, Pagadian City Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with eight children, four of whom go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

Mbodze has operated a vegetable business for the past seven years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With this 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase potatoes, fruits, onions and tomatoes for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, fruits, onions and tomatoes for her business

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 26 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

Pilar works in snack processing and vending activities and earns approximately PHP2,500.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients for her snack processing business. 

Pilar has been a member of PMPC for just this year. In the future, Pilar hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her snack processing business.

loans.name: Angela Herlinda

texts.es:
La señora Ángela  de 34 años de edad,  es  madre soltera tiene dos hijos  que depende de ella, se dedica desde hace 20  años al negocio de venta de tortillas y lo realiza de lunes a domingo.
Doña Ángela también vende golosinas y muele maíz a los vecinos en su molino,  sus clientes son  los vecinos y amigos que llegan a su casa a comprar las tortillas, ella vende 700.00 lempiras diarios.
Doña Ángela es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha para salir adelante con  sus hijos y poder darles una buena educación. Cabe mencionar que ya tiene una hija profesional que le ayuda económicamente. 
Doña Ángela está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de materia prima para elaborar las tortillas como maíz, leña, cal, repuestos para el molino y comprarse una puerta de metal nueva para la parte del frente de su casa porque la que tiene esta mala y por seguridad quiere cambiarla.
Doña Ángela con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar un poco sus ingresos, su sueño es ir mejorando su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
Ángela is 34 years old.  She is a single mother to two children who depend on her.  For twenty years Ángela has had a business selling tortillas - she works seven days a week.

Ángela also sells sweets and uses her grinder to mill corn for her neighbours.  Her customers are neighbours and friends who come to her house to buy tortillas.  Ángela sells 700.00 Lempiras worth every day.

Ángela is very hard-working and is fighting to get ahead with her children and to give them a good upbringing. Ángela also has a professional daughter who supports her financially.

Ángela is applying for a loan in order to buy basic supplies to make her tortillas.  She will buy items such as corn, firewood, lime and parts for her grinder.  She will also buy a new, metal door for the front part of her house as the current door is in bad condition and, for security reasons, she would like to change it.

With the support of this loan, Ángela plans to increase her income a little.  She dreams of continue to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras; July 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime, and parts for her grinder, for her business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 36 years old and from Nyahururu. He is married to Esther who is a businesswoman and they have one child aged 3 years.

He is a farmer and he has been in this business for the past seven years. He has applied for a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings from KADET Ltd. This is his fifth loan, and his plan is to use it for buying onion seeds and fertilizers and for paying his workers on the farm.

His hope and dream for the future is to buy land for horticultural use.

loans.use: To buy onion seeds and fertilizers and to pay workers

loans.name: Lartorkor's Group

texts.en:
This group is located in the district of Teshie-Accra, Ghana. 

One of the members is Lartorkor who is a 31-years-old married woman with two sons. She hawks from 8am to 4pm through Teshie and its environs, selling silver products including cooking utensils. She has had the business for 6 years and it is going well. Through this business, she is able to provide for her sons. Her dream is to have premises where she can buy from suppliers and retail to other retail customers including plastic chairs, plates etc. She is asking for a loan to buy cooking utensils at wholesale.

Lartorkor is standing at extreme right in the photograph with the silver sieve in her hand.

The other group members earn a living from businesses selling Kenkey (maize paste), assorted soaps and smoked fish.

Lartorkor thanks everyone who helps her to realize her dream by providing the loan and promises to keep up with the repayment of her loan installments in the agreed time frame.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils at wholesale

loans.name: Soramo

texts.ru: Женщина, которая является хранительницей очага своего дома и опорой для своих детей, имеет грандиозную идею, организовать новый бизнес. Сорамо много лет не имела источника дохода. Так как ее муж имеет маленькую зарплату и не в состоянии обеспечить своих 4 детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Дети год за годом требуют больше благ, так как они развеваются вместе с развевающимся миром. Она решила организовать бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. Она долго искала помощь и наконец, она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить продукты питания. Она будет торговать на местном рынке своего района. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки продуктов питания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This woman who is the homemaker and support for her children has a great idea to organize a new business. Soramo had no source of income for many years. Since her husband's salary is small, they do not have the necessary means to provide for all four of their children. The children year after year since their birth require more and more benefits. She decided to organize a business that sells and buys food products. She has long been looking for help, and finally, she found out about "Dobesya Ospecka" organized by the Association of Business Women. She studied in a course and gained self confidence. She completed the course and got the certificate. Now she will start a business, however she does not have the money, to purchase food products. She will sell in the local market of their district. Soramo is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy food supplies. She is waiting on your kindness.

loans.use: To buy food items for organizing new business

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a 30-years-old man from Nyahururu. He is married to Lucy, who is a housewife and they have one child who is 1 year old. He is a tailor and he also sells second hand clothing, a business which he has operated for the past 7 years. He has applied for his first loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings from Kadet Ltd which he intends to use for buying more materials for his tailoring business. His hopes and dreams for the future is to be self reliant.

loans.use: to buy  clothing materials for his tailoring shop

loans.name: Lyova

texts.en:
Lyova is 59 years old and he lives in the village Tsovagyugh which is in Gegharkunik region. Unfortunately he has serious problems connected with his health. For many years, he has worked as a bus driver, but after having heart attack he had to leave his work and he even had a heart operation. Lyova is married and has a daughter (she is married) and a son.
His son works at the gas center as the chief of the shift and his work is the main source of income for their family. After the operation for some time Lyova felt good and he began to work with his son, but now again he feels some discomforts and he has some complaints of his heart. He needs to pass some serious and very expensive examinations, and after that he must also pass some treatment processes. This is why he asks a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams in order to solve his health problems and to continue living a normal and full life.

loans.use: to pay for expensive medical examinations and treatment for his heart condition

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 31-years-old man from Nakuru. He is married to Teresiah, who is a housewife and they have 2 children, aged 8 and 4 years old.
He operates a grocery shop, a business he has been in for the past 5 years. He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET Ltd which he plans to use for buying more stock like sugar and cooking fat for his grocery shop. Peter hopes to own a home and to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock like sugar and cooking fat for his grocery shop

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en: Kamene appreciates the previous loan that helped her run her fish selling business. In addition, she also runs a vegetable stall and she is requesting a loan of Ksh.10000 to purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and vegetables for her business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a youthful man of about 35 years living in the Kiwaguzi local area. He has a family of 6 kids that he takes care of. He ventures in bark clothmaking,a business which he has done for the last 4 years. He couples it with subsistence agriculture for a daily income activity. He says he started bark clothmaking to supplement earnings from his plantation, which usually gives earnings only after 2 weeks.
He says he managed to acquire the motorcycle that has helped him with transportation, which has boosted his income. He was able to buy a piece of land that has allowed him plant more bananas for more output.Of recent he has managed to assemble some bricks which he hopes to use to put up a semi permanent house to improve his house hold living. He hopes to use the facility extended to him to mulch his plantation especially as it’s been a dry spell and also buy more back cloth for trade. He confesses a major challenge is scarcity of the bark cloth and also pests like termites that eat up the tree trunks, hence having poor quality pieces of bark cloth.

loans.use: to buy mulches for his banana plantation

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta is 44 years old and lives in Logan Town, one of the early, well-known communities in Liberia. She is married and has five children between the ages of 28 and 13, but only two are presently in school and live at home. She was unfortunate to attend school but she said, "I've managed my business well for the past six years now. I have been running containers selling cement. Presently, I have more customers." 

Fanta started this business with small goods given to her as a loan from her father and she managed to turn it into a big one. She learned this way of trading from her father. She is very happy with her business because she makes lot of profits and it provides cash for her expenses. She is proud of her business because it makes her popular. She describes herself as a hard working woman. 

100,000 LRD was given to her as a loan as she requested to purchase more cement for her business. Her plan is to build a decent house for her children. She thanks the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more cement for her business.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Las Estrellas es un grupo integrado por  9 personas alegres y emprendedoras el cual se encuentra ubicado en  una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros que cuanta con un bachillerato la principal actividad economica es la siembra y cultivo d caña de azucar.

Doña Avelina tiene la edad de 57 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Bonifacio el cual se dedica al trabajo del campo. 
Doña Avelina platica que hace mas de 30 años abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y con el pasar de los años le fue invirtiendo mas y metió un poco de papelería, su 

tienda es una de las mas grandes y mejor surtidas de la comunidad, ademas de tener sus abarrotes ella vende pollo en su casa de lunes a domingo con sus amigos y 

vecinos, doña avelina es una mujer muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, ella nos dice que inicio atrabajar en su negocio porque deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos 

del hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y ahora solo desea que su negocio prospere dia a dia para ayudar a sus hijas a dale estudios a sus nietos, ella necesita 

este credito para invertirlo en la compra de lapiz, lapiceros, hojas blancas y de colores, resistol, tijeras, cartilinas, papel bond, plastilina, unicel, fomy, cuadernos, libretas, laminas,arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, jabon, pasta dental, refrescos, dulces, cafe, galletas, jugos, veladoras, crema, queso, tomates, chiles, cebolla y papel higienico ara resurtir su negocio. 
ella se encuentra muy contenta por el prestamo otorgado y envia un saludo a vision fund y mucho agradecimiento ya que con este préstamo hará que su 

negocio prospere.

los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Haydee venta de papelería
Abigail venta de refrescos 
Eleazar venta de bisutería
Teresa aguilar venta de abarrotes 
Laura venta de tamales 
Teresa  roman venta de tamales
Juana venta de frutas y legumbres
Aurelia venta de masa y tortillas
texts.en:
"Las Estrellas" (The Stars) is a group consisting of 9 happy and enterprising people who are located in a community named Arroyo which is characterized by being the only community for several kilometers that has a high school. The primary activity is planting and growing sugar cane.

Doña Avelina is 57 years old, she completed elementary school, is married to Bonifacio who is a farmer. Doña Avelina says that over 30 years ago she opened a small grocery store and over the years she invested more into it and expanded with to include some office supplies. Her store is one of the largest and well-stocked in the community. In addition to having groceries she sells chicken from her home Monday through Sunday with her friends and neighbors. Doña Avelina is a very happy woman, enthusiastic and hard-working. She tells us that she began working in her business when she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and provide a better quality of life to her children. And now she wishes that her business prospers every day in order to help her be able to provide an education to her grandchildren.

She needs this loan to invest in buying pencils, pencil sharpeners, white and color paper, glue, scissors, mats, bond paper, clay, foam, notebooks, laminate, rice, beans, oil, laundry soap, soap, toothpaste, soda pop, candy, coffee, cookies, juices, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, chilies, onion, and toilet paper to restock her business. She is very happy for the awarded loan and sends a greeting and many thanks because with this loan her business will prosper.

The other members of the group are:
Haydee sells office supplies.
Abigail sells refreshments.
Eleazar sells costume jewelry.
Teresa rents a grocery business.
Laura sells tamales.
Teresa sells tamales.
Juana sells fruits and vegetables.
Aurelia sells flour and tortillas.

loans.use: to buy pencils, pencil sharpeners, white and color paper, glue, scissors, mats, bond paper, clay, foam, notebooks, laminate, rice, beans, oil, laundry soap, soap, toothpaste, soda pop, candy, coffee, cookies, juices, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, chilies, onion, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah is a 57 year old business lady in Thika who is married to Simon. She earns a living by selling secondhand clothes. Due to limited income to fund her business, Keziah has been unable to expand her business. That is why she decided to request a loan from KADET LTD that would enable her to purchase more bales of clothes, thus expanding her customer base. This, in return, will increase her sales and increase her profits, too. 

With the additional income earned from this improvement, Keziah will reinvest in her business and repay her loan. In the future, Keziah would like to expand her business and start selling new clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Mirna Lizeth

texts.es:
La joven Mirna  es una persona muy emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora vive con su esposo y su hijo en una comunidad al sur  de  Honduras. Su negocio es la compra  y  venta de Ganado y es su principal fuente de ingresos.
Mirna el préstamo lo necesita para la comprar  de más ganado,  debido a que tiene bastante demanda por sus clientes y para poder cumplir con todas ellas  necesita el préstamo,  ella no cuenta con el  capital necesario para comprar más mercancía.
Mirna vende el ganado  lo  vende en los alrededores de su comunidad y sectores aledaños y otros lugares cercanos.  En unos años el sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo y le brinde los ingresos necesarios para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y así  apoyar a su hijo y esposo.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Julio  del 2013
texts.en:
Young Mirna is very enterprising, responsible and hard-working.  She lives with her husband and son in a community south of Honduras.  She has a business buying and selling cattle - this is her main source of income.

Mirna needs this loan to buy more cattle as she has quite a bit of demand from customers and she wants to meet their needs.  Mirna needs this loan - she does not have the necessary capital to buy more merchandise.

Mirna sells the cattle in the outskirts of her community and nearby neighbourhoods.  Mirna dreams of her business growing in some years and wants to have the necessary income to be able to have a better quality of living and thus support her husband and son.

Choluteca, Honduras; July 2013

loans.use: to buy cows for her business.

loans.name: Fernando Alson

texts.pt:
O Sr. Fernando de 33 anos de idade, solteiro e tem 4 filhos que estao a frequentar escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ele é seguranca .
Com o presente emprestimopretende comprar de material de construcao (blocos, cimento,ferro, area e porta) para iniciar com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem como esperanca construir ate a conclusao da sua casa com fundos da hluvuku-adsema e no futura apetrecha-la.
texts.en: Fernando is thirty-three, is single, and has four children who are in primary and secondary school.  He works as a security guard.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials (blocks, cement, iron, sand, and a door) to start construction on his home.  He hopes to build his home until it is finished with funds from Hluvuku-Adsema and in the future to furnish it.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (blocks, cement, iron, sand, and a door) to start construction on his home.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
La señora María Emilia  de 64 años de edad es soltera, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella,  vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 13  años  al negocio de venta  ropa interior.
Doña María Emilia sus ventas son de forma ambulante también vende en las afueras del mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo, es una persona trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña María Emilia está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de ropa interior como blúmeres, braseares, calcetines para niños y adultos, ya que tiene demanda para esta época  que es la feria de su pueblo, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos  y de esa manera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida.
Doña María Emilia su sueño es mejorar  su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en: Señora María Emilia is sixty-four and single.  She doesn't have children that depend on her.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras.  She has her own home and has made a living for thirteen years by selling underwear.  María Emilia works as a street vendor on the outskirts of the new market of San Lorenzo.  She is a hard-working person with a desire to get ahead.  She is requesting a loan to purchase underwear like briefs, bras, and socks for children and adults.  She has demand right now because it is festival time in her town.  With the support of this loan, she expects to improve her income and in this way improve her quality of life a little bit.  Her dream is to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy underwear, bras, and socks for her business.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 39 years old. She lives in Sevan City, which is in Gegharkunik region. She is married and has two school-aged children. Naira lives with her retired mother-in-law and two children. Her husband is in the Russian Federation and financially takes care of his family from there. Naira for several years worked at the shoe factory as a designer. Then she changed her work and now she works at the bread factory as a baker.


Several years ago her father-in–law died in a car crash, and Naira asks for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to place a gravestone for him.

loans.use: to place a gravestone.

loans.name: Marta Nelly

texts.es: Marta, a sus 66 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 3 hijos. Desde hace 25 años se dedica a la venta de frutas en un puesto ambulante que tiene en el centro del municipio donde reside y cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado, con esto ha logrado obtener los ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos, pues toda la carga económica recayó sobre ella, luego del abandono del padre de sus hijos y además paga la nómina del trabajador. Marta es una señora trabajadora, juiciosa, y entregada a su familia, siempre se propone metas para salir adelante, por esa razón solicita el apoyo del séptimo ciclo de crédito para  realizar mejoras en el puesto de trabajo (arreglar la sombrilla) y comprar surtido de frutas al por mayor (piña, banano, mango, naranja, kiwi) para darle un mejor aspecto a su negocio que llame la atención de muchos más clientes y tener variedad de productos para ofrecer, de esta forma aumentará los ingresos por venta y tendrá la capacidad económica para continuar con su negocio, brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar y un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en: Marta is 66 years old. She is single and the mother of 3 children. For 25 years, she has worked selling fruit as a street vendor at a spot she has in the center of the town where she lives. She has the help of one employee and has been able to obtain the income she needs to support her children. All of the financial burden fell on her shoulders after their father abandoned them. She also pays her employee. Marta is a hardworking, wise woman who is dedicated to her family. She always sets goals to get ahead. That is why she is asking for the help of the seventh credit cycle to make improvements on her work space (fixing the umbrella) and to buy a variety of fruit wholesale (pineapples, bananas, mangos, oranges, and kiwis) to give her business a better appearance and get more customers' attention, as well as have a variety of products to offer. This way, she will increase her sales income and have the financial capacity to continue with her business and offer her family better well being and a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to make improvements on her workspace (fixing the umbrella) and buying a variety of fruit wholesale (pineapples, bananas, mangos, oranges and kiwis).

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, a 57-year-old widowed mother of five from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. This marks her third loan term with KADET after repaying her previous loans successfully. 

With the loan she has applied from KADET LTD, she will be able to purchase poultry feeds and a dairy cow. Additional income created will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family and also reinvest in her farming business. In the future, Esther would like to buy more dairy cows. 

She hopes to save money to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi appreciates the previous loan that enabled her to buy bales of clothes for her clothes-selling business. In addition, she is requesting a loan of Ksh.10,000 to renovate her clothing shop by renovating the roof.

loans.use: to renovate her clothing shop by renovating the roof.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Сабохат является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж занимается бизнесом. Сабохат давно мечтала иметь своё дело и стать экономически не зависимой. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Difficult times can make a person concentrate all their efforts and use their existing resources.  Sabohat is one of those people who tries to improve her living conditions and to enhance her family's economic standing.  She is married and is raising three children.  Her husband is in business.  Sabohat has dreamed for a long time about having her own business and becoming economically independent.  

It was with this goal in mind that Sabohat studied in the "Woman Entrepreneur, Get Ahead" course that is put on by the Organization of Business Women and she earned her certificate of completion.  Now she is completely able to start her own business and be successful in her field.  She wants to start a business in trading cattle since she has experience with this.  She is planning to use the profit she earns to provide her children with good educations and high calorie foods.  She is requesting a loan of 500 somoni (TJS) to buy cattle to start her new business.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business

loans.name: Esmeralda 27 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ESMERALDA 27,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,   el presidente del banco es el Sr. Jose tiene 44 años, casado con dos  hijos  que ya son mayores de edad,  su actividad económica es venta de adornos hechos de mármol, el se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo, el destino del crédito es para la compra de variedad de adornos de mármol por mayor para surtir sus productos, el Sr. Jose es una persona trabajadora, ya que esta es única fuente de ingresos, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado,  el deseo del Sr. Jose es tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer variedad de productos como también incrementar su clientela para generar mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The ESMERALDA 27 communal bank has eight members, six women and two men. The president is Jose. He is 44 years old, married with two grown children. For a long time now he has sold ornaments made out of marble. This loan will be used to buy a variety of marble ornaments to give him more variety in his offerings. Jose is a hardworking person and this is his only source of income. He is very grateful to Emprender for the support it offers. His dream is to have a store where he can offer a variety of products and increase his clientele in order to increase his revenues.

loans.use: to buy marble ornaments.

loans.name: Nelda Aracely

texts.es: Nelda, tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años y ofrece tortillas de maíz. Inicio este negocio con el propósito de ayudar con los gastos del hogar. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 Lempiras el cual será invertido en la compra de productos para la venta de tortillas como es la harina de maíz. También utilizara parte del préstamo para arreglar la galera donde tiene su hornilla para brindar mejor servicio al cliente. Su meta es seguir trabajando para poderles dar mejor estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Nelda is 29 years old, married and has three children. She lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula. She has had a business selling tortillas for the last two years. She makes corn tortillas. She started this business as a means to help pay the household expenses. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Lempiras, which will be used to buy products to make the tortillas such as corn flour. She will use part of the loan to  fix up the area where she has the oven in order to better serve her clients. Her goal is to continue working in order to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy corn flour to make tortillas and to repair the area with the oven where she makes the tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, wood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Gulhinamo

texts.ru: Гулхинамо 21 года. Она не замужем и живёт с родителями на севере Таджикистана. Она умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Гулхинамо училась успешно в средней школе, но по семейным обстоятельствам, она не смогла поступить в университет. Она обучилась у портнихи шитью женской одежды. Она уже в течение нескольких лет имеет опыта в сфере шитья и кройки. Она уверенна, в себе, что может самостоятельно организовать свой бизнес, шитьём женской одежды. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulhinamo is 21 years old.  She is not married and lives with her parents in northern Tajikistan.  She is smart and hard working young woman.  Gulhinamo studied successfully in high school, but because of family circumstances, she was not able to enter the university.  She learned to sew women's clothes from a dress maker.  She already has several years experience in fabric cutting and sewing.  

She is confident that she can start a business sewing women's clothing on her own.  She studied in the course called  "Woman Entrepreneur, Get Ahead" that is put on by the Association of Business Women, and she earned her completion certificate.  Gulhinamo is requesting a loan of 500 somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start her new business

loans.name: Alfiya

texts.ru: Алфия добросовестная женщина. Ей 50 лет. Она разведена и имеет 2 детей. Детям 23 и 22 года. Она вырастила детей сама, так как после развода ей не на кого было надеяться. Алфия решила организовать свой бизнес купле продажей детской одежды, так как ей очень нравилось купить детям одежду, и она мечтала начать бизнес купле продажей детской одежды. Она участвовала на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она много научилась из данного курса. Она не имеет средства для покупки детской одежды для того, чтобы начать свой бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки детской одежды. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Alfiya is a conscientious woman. She is 50 years old. She is divorced and has two children. Her children are 23 and 22 years old. She brought up her children by herself since after the divorce she had no one to count on. Alfiya has decided to launch a business buying and reselling children’s clothing, since she used to enjoy shopping for her children’s clothes, and   would dream of having her own business selling children’s clothing. She has completed a “Reach for Success” course organized by the Association of Businesswomen and obtained a certificate of completion. She learned a lot from this course. She lacks the means to stock up on children’s clothing and launch her business. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,000 TJS to buy children’s clothing. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for launching a new business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, a 29 year old single mother of two from Thika, earns a living and supports her family by operating a tailoring shop. She has been in this business for the past four years and earns a monthly income of 13,400 KES. 

This marks Joyce's third loan from KADET LTD and she is grateful for the support she has been receiving, which has made it possible to grow her business. She intends to use the loan to purchase more clothing materials to make clothes for her customers. The additional income created will allow her to improve her family's standard of living and invest in her children’s education. 

She hopes to save money to educate her children to college level.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing materials.

loans.name: Lilik

texts.en:
Lilik lives in Kapan city, which is in the Syunik region. Lilik graduated from Kapan Medical College with a specialty in nursing, but she has never worked as a nurse. Lilik is married and she has two school-aged sons. Her husband works as a driver. 

Lilik has been engaged in a clothes-selling business for eight years. At first she worked from her house. After saving some money and gaining a lot of loyal customers, she decided to rent a small stall and enlarge her business. Lilik sells children's and women's clothes, women's underwear and a large variety of shoes. She buys products for her stall from Yerevan wholesale markets with the help of her husband.  

Lilik has asked for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy seasonal clothes for children and women. She hopes very much that this loan will bring a decent income to her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes for children and women

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 28 years old. He is married to Monicah and they are blessed with one child. 

Daniel has been selling clothes for the past seven years and earns a monthly income of 120,000 KES. He has seen his business grow steadily and now has requested a second loan of 65,000 KES to introduce a new line of clothing. The profit he earns from his business will help him expand this business, which is also his dream.

loans.use: To purchase bales of blouses and trousers for sale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia appreciates for the loan she was given that enabled her to buy some household items to sell. She is requesting another loan of 30,000 KES to purchase different types of utensils to meet high customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase different types of utensils to meet customer demand

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 47 years old and lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities of Liberia that is well known. She is unmarried and has four children between the ages of  9 and 23, including some who are in school and live at home. Mamie did not attend school. For the past six years, she has been running a store where she sells fashion clothes such as jeans and blouses, and African clothes such as dresses, blouses and slippers. She started this business with her small savings and established it by learning the ways of selling from her friends. She likes her business because she makes a profit and it keeps her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy more fashion clothes and African clothes for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fashion clothes and African clothes for her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 46 years old, married to Joseph Cheptumo and they are blessed with eight children ranging in age from 6 to 20. She has been managing her livestock and selling milk in large quantities for five years. Her monthly income is 6000 KES.

This loan of 20000 KES is her ninth wth KADET Ltd. She has repaid previous loans successfully. She wishes to use this amount to purchase dairy feed for her livestock.The anticipated profits will be used to start different business.

Her hope and dream is to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her livestock business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a very hard-working woman.She lives in Kenya and owns a vegetable stall. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to expand her existing business. She plans to purchase fruits and potatoes, onions and other vegetables for her business to meet high customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables, including potatoes and onions, for her business

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is married and has been blessed with two school-age children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She also sells water. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase four bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Beti

texts.en: Beti is a hardworking woman who owns a vegetable stall in Kenya. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase vegetables, fruits, spices and tomatoes for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, spices and tomatoes for her business.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
